Technique:
1. Keep right foot pressed on perineum and left foot on top.
2. Place hands on two knees, sit upright 3. Fix gaze to third eye.
Visualization: Visualize Lord Surya in your inner space
Sanskrit Verse:
pari mūladvāra ṭekī baisai ḍāvā paga kī yeḍī
jīmaṇau paga moḍī pagathalī kī māhilī kora
yoni sthāna kāṭhī rāṣai phaṇau jīmaṇī
jaṃgamāhilī kānī lagāvai hastha goḍā pari rāṣai
ṣavā saṃjugati sāro sarira sama rāṣai
caḍhato caḍhato mahūrata aika sādhai driṣṭi kau trakauṭī
āsaṇa kauguṇapavanadhāraṇa sahaita sādhaito birajibaṃdha hoī
Translation: By sitting on floor, bend right leg and set right foot below anus. Place left heel at the perineum and set toes between right thigh and calf. Place hands on two knees and sit upright. Fix the gaze in between the eyebrows. It should be progressively practiced to be able to maintain for one muhurta. When this asana is practiced with pranadharana, it brings control on flow of semen
Sanskrit Verse.1:
जीमणौ पग मोडी पगथली की माǑहली कोर
पǐर मूलद्वार टेकी बैसैडावा पग की येडी
योǓन स्थान काठी राषैफणौ जीमणी
जंगमाǑहली कानी लगावैहस्थ गोडा पǐर राषै
षवा संजुगǓत सारो सǐरर सम राषै
चढतो चढतो महूरत ऐक साधैǑद्रिष्ट कौ त्रकौटी
आसण कौगुणपवनधारण सहैत साधैतो ǒबरिजबंध होई

Technique:
1. Keep right heel at perineum and left foot on top.
2. Hands on top of knees. 3. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize you’re the weapon of Indra, representing indestructibility
Sanskrit Verse:
savyena kamdam pripīdya cānyam pādam tu limgopari nikşipecca ।
vajam sadā prāṇajaye ca siddham grīvātanūmastasamastaśastam
Translation: Sit on floor with legs extended. Bend the left leg at the knee and place left heel pressing at the perineum. Now fold right leg also and put right foot over the organ of generation. Keep neck, trunk and head upright.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
सव्येन कं दं ͪप्रपीड्य चान्यंपादं तुͧल ंगोपǐर
Ǔनͯक्षपेच्च ।
वजंसदा प्राणजयेच ͧसद्धं
ग्रीवातनूमस्तसमस्तशस्तं॥

Technique:
1. Keep right heel at perineum and left foot on top.
2. Place hands on top of the knees. 3. Press chin down on chest.
4. Gaze to third eye.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as a Siddha Yoga Master
Sanskrit Verse:
atha bhāsamānā prayogā:
aśa sihāsanam ।
yonisthānakamadhimūlaghaṭitaṃs
aṃpīya gulphetaraṃ
meḍha◌़oparyatha savidhātha cibukaṃ kṛtvā hadi sthāpitam ।
sthāṇuḥ saṃyamitendriyo'calahaśā paśyan vārantara
memokṣavidhāyatephalakara siddhāsana proṣyate ।। 7 ॥
Translation: The practitioner who has subdued his passions, having placed one heel at the anal aperture, then keep the other heal on the root of the generative organ; afterwards he should affix his chin upon the chest, and being quiet and straight, gaze at the spot between the two eye-brows. This is called the Siddh-âsana and leads to emancipation.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
अथ भासमाना प्रयोगा:
अश ͧसहासनम ्।
योǓनस्थानकमͬधमूलघǑटतंसंपीय गुल्फे तरं
मेढ़ोपयर्णथ सͪवधाथ ͬचबुकं कृ त्वा हǑद स्थाͪपतम ्
।
स्थाणुः संयͧमतेिÛद्रयोऽचलहशा पश्यन ्वारÛतर
मेमोक्षिͪवधायतेफलकर ͧसद्धासन प्रोष्यते।। ७

1. Place right foot at perineum and left foot over top.
2. Keep left toes between thighs and legs.
3. Keep hands cupped together on right knee. 4. Gaze to the nose.

Sanskrit Verse:
pādmaṁ
brāhmaṁstathāsaiddhaṁ
svāstikaṁ vājramāsanam | baddhakonaṁ bhadrapsthaṁ
mūlabandhaṁ tathaiva ca ||
Translation: This bandha can be practiced in Padmāsana, Brahmāsana, Siddhāsana, Svastikasana, Vairasana, Baddha konasana, Bhadrasana, and Mūlabandhāsana.

Visualization: Visualize the great Sage Valmika; Author of Ramayaman
Sanskrit Verse:
baisi kari ḍāvā paga kī pagathalī yeḍi bārilā phaṇā diśi moḍi jīmaṇi pāṣatī lagāvai
jīmaṇa paga kī yeḍi bāi nali lagāvai aguṭhā goḍā lagāvai
pagathalī vākaura dharatī lagāvai dou goḍāpari rāṛau
draṣṭi trikūṭa āsaṇa kau guṇa pagā kau sojo jāī
Translation: Sit on the floor, placing left heel on the right side of the generative organ and the toes under the right thigh. In the same manner place right heel and the toes in such a way that toes come close to the left knee. Place the hands on the knees and fix the gaze between the eyebrows.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
बैͧस कǐर डावा पग की पगथली येͫड
बाǐरला फणा Ǒदͧश मोͫड जीमͨण पाषती
लगावै
जीमण पग की येͫड बाइ नͧल लगावै
अगुठा गोडा लगावै
पगथली वाकौर धरती लगावैदोउ
गोडापǐर राृऔ
द्रिष्ट ǒत्रकू ट आसण कौ गुण पगा क सोजो जाई

Sanskrit Verse:
nitambe hastayugalaṃ bhūmau saṅkocitaḥ patet |
kumbhīrāsanamāvakṣye vāyūnāṃ dhāraṇāya ca || 24-11
Translation:
Now I shall talk about kumbhīrāsana for the retention of vital breath.
Sit tall on the ground in a pot like fashion by placing both the hands on the head.
Let one foot be on the top of the other one and both the hands on the head.
Sit tall in the shape of a pot on the floor, that verily is the kumbhīrāsana.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
Ǔनतम्बेहस्तयुगलṃ भ ्ūमौ
सṅकोͬचतḥ पतेत ्।

Technique: 1. Place the thighs overtop of both heels. 2. Sit with spine straight. 3. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize each of your chakras as a bright white light
Sanskrit Verse:
savyoru dakṣiṇe gulphe dakṣiṇaṃ dakṣiṇetare |
nidadhyādṛjukāyastu cakrāsanamidaṃ matam ॥
tatra cakrāsanalakṣaṇamāha savyeti ॥ 17 ॥
Translation: One should place the left thigh over the right heel and the right thigh over the left heel with his body erect. This is considered to be the Cakra posture

तत्र चक्रासनलक्षिणमाह - सव्येǓत ॥ १७ ॥

Technique:
1. Place both feet between the opposite thighs and calves.
2. Keep hands on top of knees. 3. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Embody peace, well-being, good fortune and prosperity
Sanskrit Verse:
jānurvorantare samyagdhștvā pādatale ubhe | samakāyaḥ sukhāsīnaḥ svastikam tatpracakşate ||
anenavidhinā yogī mārutam sādhayetsudhīḥ | dehe na kramate vyādhistasya vāyuśca siddhayati ||
Translation: While sitting on the ground, cross both the legs in such a way that both feet place properly between opposite thighs and shanks. Keep a steady and upright posture
Sanskrit Verse.1:

देहेन क्रमतेव्याͬधस्तस्य वायुश्च
ͧसद्धयǓत ॥९६॥

Sanskrit Verse: pagathalé sampuōa kari āgulyā kau sampūōā karai māhé ñulo rāñai doūū hāthā ké kāgasé kari pagathalyā ké bārilé kaura yeòé dharaté tekai māhilé kaura pagathalyā ké meòhu lagāvai driñoi nāsā agra āsana kauguéa sisina bāé rukai

Technique:

2. Keep knees wide and
interlace fingers around feet. 3. Gaze to nose.

Sanskrit Verse: atha bhadrāsanam ghulphau cha vṝṣhaṇasyādhaḥ sīvantyāḥ pārśvayoḥ kṣhipte | savya-ghulphaṃ tathā savye dakṣha-ghulphaṃ tu dakṣhiṇe || 55 || pārśva-pādau cha pāṇibhyāṃ dṝḍhaṃ baddhvā suniśchalam | bhadrāsanaṃ bhavedetatsarva-vyādhi-vināśanam | ghorakṣhāsanamityāhuridaṃ vai siddha-yoghinaḥ || 56 ||
Translation: Place the heels on either side of the seam of the perineum, keeping the left heel on the left side and the right one on the right side, hold the feet firmly joined to one another with both the hands. This Bhadrâsana is the destroyer of all the diseases

Technique:
1. Extend legs in front with ankles and toes together.
2. Rest hands on thighs. 3. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as Paramaśiva’s Yoga Danda
Sanskrit Verse:
ślistarguli ślistagulphau bhuślistorū prasarayet |
yatropavisya padau tad dandāsanam udiritam || putapārsnisamāyoge prāhur utkațikásanam |
pārşnibhyām tu bhuvas tyāge tat syād godohikāsanam ||

|
पार्şǓनभ्याम ्तुभुवस ्त्यागेतत ्स्य ्āद गोदोǑहकासनम ् ||

Technique:
1. Sit with legs extended straight And hands by hips on ground.
2. Press hands down and lift entire body off ground.
3. Move the body side to side
Visualization: Visualize yourself as a cradle, rocking side to side
Sanskrit Verse: prekhavatsthitvā pādāgre pādāgre mastakeparinītvā pṛṣṭibhāge bhūmaunidhāya tiṣtet ॥74॥
Translation: Assuming the position like Prenkhasana, seated with legs extended in front and lifting the body off the ground. Then, lift the tops of the feet over the head and towards the ground behind you.

मस्तके पǐरनीत्वा पृिष्टभागे
भूमौǓनधाय Ǔतष्तेत ्॥७४॥

Technique:
1. Bend left knee and place under left buttocks, toes facing outwards.
2. Place right knee overtop of left.
3. Place hands on top of knee.
4. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: *Experience the Energy of a Temple Inside You
Sanskrit Verse:
jīmaṇā goḍo agra kari ḍāvo paga jīmaṇī pāṣatī āṇi
moḍi yeḍi kulā nīcai rāṣī phaṇā pāṇi adhara rahai
hātha goḍā ūpari rāṣai driṣṭi nāsā agra
āsaṇa kau guṇa pavana dhāraṇā shaita karai
tau jala ādide duṣa na hoī
Translation: While sitting on ground, bend right knee and place right foot under right buttock. Toes are turned sidewards. Place left folded leg on right thigh. Eyes are fixed at the tip of the nose
Sanskrit Verse.1:
जीमणा गोडो अग्र कǐर डावो पग जीमणी
पाषती आͨण
मोͫड येͫड कु ला नीचैराषी फणा पाͨण अधर
रहै
हाथ गोडा ऊपǐर राषैǑद्रिष्ट नासा अग आसण कौ गुण पवन धारणा स्हैत करै
तौ जल आǑददेदुष न होई

Technique:
1. Keep knees on top of one another and heels to opposite hips.
2. Touch right fingertips to middle joint of left fingers, resting hands on groin with palms facing upwards.3. Gaze to third eye.
Visualization: Visualize the purifying effects of durva grass happening on your being
Sanskrit Verse:
ḍāī jāṅgha parikari jīmaṇau paga ḍāī pāṣatī āṇi
phaṇaā dou dharati ṭekī bāralā gulapha kulā kī bārilī kānī lagāvai
ḍāvā hāthakī āgulyā kī bicalī syandhi syu
jimaṇā hāthakiī āgulyā kā aṅgra lagāvai
ūparā thalī sudhā hātha rāṣsai hathelī kī bāralī kora meḍhra urddha lagāvai
driṣṭi trikuṭī āsaṇa kau guṇa garamai ādidi roga jāya sītala rahai
Translation: While sitting on the ground bend right leg in the knee and place its foot on the left side of the hip. Similarly bend the left leg in the knee and place its foot on the right side of the hip. This bring the knee one over the other. Touch the tips of the fingers of right hand to the middle joints of left fingers. Place the hands supine on the genital and direct the gaze in between the eyebrows.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
डाई जाङ्घ पǐरकǐर जीमणौ पग डाई पाषती आͨण
फणआ दोउ धरǓत टेकी बारला गुलफ कु ला की बाǐरली
कानी लगावै
डावा हाथकी आगुल्या की ǒबचली स्यिÛध स्यु
िजमणा हाथͩकई आगुल्या का अङ्ग्र लगावै
ऊपरा थली सुधा हाथ राष्सैहथेली की बारली कोर मेढ्र
उद्र्णध लगावै
Ǒद्रिष्ट ǒत्रकु टी आसण कौ गुण गरमैआǑदǑद रोग जाय सीतल रह

Asana Images:

Technique:
1. Keep knees on top of one another and heels to opposite hips.
2. Touch wrists together, thumbs and little fingers touching, fingers spread wide, forming a lotus.3. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize all Gods & Goddesses are pleased with you
Sanskrit Verse:
òāmé jaìgha arū pééòé māàhé , dachana pééòé dharai su tāàhé | āàña vāma goòā māhilé , rāñai dachi goòā agramilé ॥ 294 ॥
do u péòé ko āgra jo jori , kūlā taré de vaisai moré | pahuïcā ké saìgha aisai karai , jaìgha kaòyā ké sandhi paridharai ॥ 295 ॥
so u māàhilé tarapha ju rāñai , aìgulé jaìghā vārai dāñai | aìguré chidé kari latakāvai , paìkaja kai ākāra vanāvai ॥ 296 ॥
ubhai hathelé sūdhé karai , nāsā agra drañöa kau dharai | pavana dhāraéā sahita ju sādhai , so nara kāvya sakti ko lāìghai ॥ 297 ॥
Translation: Between the left thigh and calf muscle, place the calf muscle of right leg in the manner that both the knees come closer. Join both the ankles and place them under the buttocks. Let the thigh remain together. Place the hand on thigh in such a way that fingers form like a lotus. Both the hands should remain straight. Gaze at the tip of nose.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
òāम ्é जìघ अर्ū प ्ééòé म ्āàह्é , दचन प ्ééòé धरैसुत ्āàह्é ।
āàñअ व ्āम गोòā म ्āǑहल ्é , र्āñऐ दͬच गोòā अग्रͧमल ्é ॥ २९४ ॥
दो उ प ्éòé को āग्र जो जोǐर , क्ūल ्ā तर्é देवैसैमोर्é ।
पहुïच ्ā क्é सìघ ऐसैकरै ,
जìघ कòय ्ā क्é सिÛध पǐरधरै॥ २९५ ॥
सो उ म ्āàǑहल ्é तरफ जुर्āñऐ , अìगुल ्é जìघ ्ā व ्āरैद्āñऐ ।
अìगुर्é ͬचद्é कǐर लतक्āवै , पìकज कै āक्āर वन ्āवै॥ २९६ ॥
उभैहथेल ्é स ्ūध ्é करै ,
न ्āस ्ā अग्र द्रñöअ कौ धरै।
पवन ध ्āरéā सǑहत जुस ्āधै ,
सो नर क्āव्य सिÈत को ल ्āìघै॥ २९७ ॥

दो उ प ्éòé को āग्र जो जोǐर , क्ūल ्ā तर्é देवैसैमोर्é ।
पहुïच ्ā क्é सìघ ऐसैकरै ,
जìघ कòय ्ā क्é सिÛध पǐरधरै॥ २९५ ॥
सो उ म ्āàǑहल ्é तरफ जुर्āñऐ , अìगुल ्é जìघ ्ā व ्āरैद्āñऐ ।
अìगुर्é ͬचद्é कǐर लतक्āवै , पìकज कै āक्āर वन ्āवै॥ २९६ ॥
उभैहथेल ्é स ्ūध ्é करै ,
न ्āस ्ā अग्र द्रñöअ कौ धरै।
पवन ध ्āरéā सǑहत जुस ्āधै ,

Unnamed: 20:
Asana Number: 334
Asana Name: SUKHA DEVA ASANA
Technique: 1. Keep knees on top of one another and heels to opposite hips.
2. Touch wrists together, thumbs and little fingers touching, fingers spread wide, forming a lotus.3. Gaze to nose.
Pranamaya: Sitkari Kumbhaka
Bandha: Padma Mudra
Mudra: Mula Bandha
Visualization: Visualize all Gods & Goddesses are pleased with you
Gaze: To nose
Japa: Om Nithyananda
ParamaShivoham
Pramana Source: ĀptaPramana-आप्तप्रमाण
JogaPradipika294-297
Sanskrit Verse (Pramana): òāmé jaìgha arū pééòé māàhé , dachana pééòé dharai su tāàhé | āàña vāma goòā māhilé , rāñai dachi goòā agramilé ॥ 294 ॥
do u péòé ko āgra jo jori , kūlā taré de vaisai moré | pahuïcā ké saìgha aisai karai , jaìgha kaòyā ké sandhi paridharai ॥ 295 ॥
so u māàhilé tarapha ju rāñai , aìgulé jaìghā vārai dāñai | aìguré chidé kari latakāvai , paìkaja kai ākāra vanāvai ॥ 296 ॥
ubhai hathelé sūdhé karai , nāsā agra drañöa kau dharai | pavana dhāraéā sahita ju sādhai , so nara kāvya sakti ko lāìghai ॥ 297 ॥
Verse Translation: Between the left thigh and calf muscle, place the calf muscle of right leg in the manner that both the knees come closer. Join both the ankles and place them under the buttocks. Let the thigh remain together. Place the hand on thigh in such a way that fingers form like a lotus. Both the hands should remain straight. Gaze at the tip of nose.

Technique:
1. Keep knees on top of one another and heels to opposite hips.
2. Place hands on feet and hold firmly.
3. Keep spine straight and gaze to third eye.
Visualization: Shiva has blessed you to move beyond all material needs and desires
Sanskrit Verse:
prathama jīvaṇo pāva ucāve ḍāī jaṅgha upari kari lyāve |
ḍāī pākhatī tāko āne goḍāṃ upara tala kari ṭhane |
pagathaliyā bāharakī kaura dharantī ṭeke rākhai jora || 246 ||
tirachī paga aḍhā ju pasāre kūlāṃ eḍayā aṅtara dhārai |
mūṅḍa hātha unamāna su rākhe dou kara pāvana pari dākhai || 247 ||
lāṅka pagathalīkī jo doū ubhai hasta so pakarai soū |
trikuṭī driṣṭi dharai puna dhīra samasarīra rākhai kari thīra || 248 ||
pavana dhāraṇā sahita yo āsana sādhai koya |
sīta vāta kā roga te so nara muktā hoya || 249 ||
Translation: While sitting bring the right leg over the left thigh and place the foot touching the ground. Bring left foot on right side and place it’s heel close to the buttock. Place the hands on feet and hold them firmly. Sit straight and direct the gaze in between eyebrows.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
प्रथम जीवणो पाव उचावेडाई जङ्घ उपǐर कǐर ल्यावे |
डाई पाखती ताको आनेगोडांउपर तल कǐर ठने |
पगथͧलया बाहरकी कौर धरÛती टेके राखैजोर || २४६
||
Ǔतरछी पग अढा जुपसारेकू लांएडया अङ्तर धारै |
मूङ्ड हाथ उनमान सुराखेदोउ कर पावन पǐर दाखै || २४७ ||
लाङ्क पगथलीकी जो दोऊ उभैहस्त सो पकरैसोऊ |
ǒत्रकु टी Ǒद्रिष्ट धरैपुन धीर समसरीर राखैकǐर थीर || २४८ ||
पवन धारणा सǑहत यो आसन साधैकोय |
सीत वात का रोग तेसो नर मुÈता होय || २४९ ||

Technique:
1. Keep knees on top of one another and heels to opposite hips.
2. Hold the big toes and bring forehead down.3. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as a fish
Sanskrit Verse: jīmaņau paga dāī jāmgha pari rāșai yeļi kaời lagāvai dāvāya kau bāralo gūlapha jīmāmņā gidākī māhili āșyā pari rāșai dou hāthā syau pagakā agāthā pakadai lilāța dharati lagāvai chātī kadā syau lagāvai āsaņa kauguņa godā kī pirā jāī
Translation: Sit on floor and by folding the knees, place one knee over the other. Join the feet under the bottoms with hands and hold them firmly. Bend the head forward over the knees
Sanskrit Verse.1:
जीमणौ पग डाई जांघ पǐर राषैयेडी कͫड
लगावैडावाय कौ बारलो गूलफ जीमांणा
ͬगडाकी माǑहली आष्या पǐर राषैदोउ हाथा
स्यौ पगका अगूठा पकडैͧललाट धरती
लगावैछाती कडा स्यौ लगावैआसण कौगुण गोडा की ͪपरा जाई

Sanskrit Verse:
jīmaṇā goḍo agra kari ḍāvo paga jīmaṇī pāṣatī āṇi
moḍi yeḍi kulā nīcai rāṣī phaṇā pāṇi adhara rahai
hātha goḍā ūpari rāṣai driṣṭi nāsā agra
āsaṇa kau guṇa pavana dhāraṇā shaita karai
tau jala ādide duṣa na hoī
Translation: While sitting on ground, bend right knee and place right foot under right buttock. Toes are turned sidewards. Place left folded leg on right thigh. Eyes are fixed at the tip of the nose.

जीमणा गोडो अग्र कǐर डावो पग जीमणी

Sanskrit Verse (Pramana): jīmaṇā goḍo agra kari ḍāvo paga jīmaṇī pāṣatī āṇi
moḍi yeḍi kulā nīcai rāṣī phaṇā pāṇi adhara rahai
hātha goḍā ūpari rāṣai driṣṭi nāsā agra
āsaṇa kau guṇa pavana dhāraṇā shaita karai
tau jala ādide duṣa na hoī
Verse Translation: While sitting on ground, bend right knee and place right foot under right buttock. Toes are turned sidewards. Place left folded leg on right thigh. Eyes are fixed at the tip of the nose.

Technique:
1. Keep knees on top of one another and heels to opposite hips.
2. Touch right fingertips to middle joint of left fingers, resting hands on groin with palms facing upwards.3. Gaze to third eye.
Visualization: Visualize the purifying effects of durva grass happening on your being
Sanskrit Verse:
ḍāī jāṅgha parikari jīmaṇau paga ḍāī pāṣatī āṇi
phaṇaā dou dharati ṭekī bāralā gulapha kulā kī bārilī kānī lagāvai
ḍāvā hāthakī āgulyā kī bicalī syandhi syu
jimaṇā hāthakiī āgulyā kā aṅgra lagāvai
ūparā thalī sudhā hātha rāṣsai hathelī kī bāralī kora meḍhra urddha lagāvai
driṣṭi trikuṭī āsaṇa kau guṇa garamai ādidi roga jāya sītala rahai
Translation: While sitting on the ground bend right leg in the knee and place its foot on the left side of the hip. Similarly bend the left leg in the knee and place its foot on the right side of the hip. This bring the knee one over the other. Touch the tips of the fingers of right hand to the middle joints of left fingers. Place the hands supine on the genital and direct the gaze in between the eyebrows.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
डाई जाङ्घ पǐरकǐर जीमणौ पग डाई पाषती आͨण
फणआ दोउ धरǓत टेकी बारला गुलफ कु ला की बाǐरली
कानी लगावै
डावा हाथकी आगुल्या की ǒबचली स्यिÛध स्यु
िजमणा हाथͩकई आगुल्या का अङ्ग्र लगावै
ऊपरा थली सुधा हाथ राष्सैहथेली की बारली कोर मेढ्र
उद्र्णध लगावै
Ǒद्रिष्ट ǒत्रकु टी आसण कौ गुण गरमैआǑदǑद रोग जाय सीतल रह

Technique:
1. Keep knees on top of one another and heels to opposite hips.
2. Touch wrists together, thumbs and little fingers touching, fingers spread wide, forming a lotus.3. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize all Gods & Goddesses are pleased with you
Sanskrit Verse:
òāmé jaìgha arū pééòé māàhé , dachana pééòé dharai su tāàhé | āàña vāma goòā māhilé , rāñai dachi goòā agramilé ॥ 294 ॥
do u péòé ko āgra jo jori , kūlā taré de vaisai moré | pahuïcā ké saìgha aisai karai , jaìgha kaòyā ké sandhi paridharai ॥ 295 ॥
so u māàhilé tarapha ju rāñai , aìgulé jaìghā vārai dāñai | aìguré chidé kari latakāvai , paìkaja kai ākāra vanāvai ॥ 296 ॥
ubhai hathelé sūdhé karai , nāsā agra drañöa kau dharai | pavana dhāraéā sahita ju sādhai , so nara kāvya sakti ko lāìghai ॥ 297 ॥
Translation: Between the left thigh and calf muscle, place the calf muscle of right leg in the manner that both the knees come closer. Join both the ankles and place them under the buttocks. Let the thigh remain together. Place the hand on thigh in such a way that fingers form like a lotus. Both the hands should remain straight. Gaze at the tip of nose.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
òāम ्é जìघ अर्ū प ्ééòé म ्āàह्é , दचन प ्ééòé धरैसुत ्āàह्é ।
āàñअ व ्āम गोòā म ्āǑहल ्é , र्āñऐ दͬच गोòā अग्रͧमल ्é ॥ २९४ ॥
दो उ प ्éòé को āग्र जो जोǐर , क्ūल ्ā तर्é देवैसैमोर्é ।
पहुïच ्ā क्é सìघ ऐसैकरै ,
जìघ कòय ्ā क्é सिÛध पǐरधरै॥ २९५ ॥
सो उ म ्āàǑहल ्é तरफ जुर्āñऐ , अìगुल ्é जìघ ्ā व ्āरैद्āñऐ ।
अìगुर्é ͬचद्é कǐर लतक्āवै , पìकज कै āक्āर वन ्āवै॥ २९६ ॥
उभैहथेल ्é स ्ūध ्é करै ,
न ्āस ्ā अग्र द्रñöअ कौ धरै।
पवन ध ्āरéā सǑहत जुस ्āधै ,
सो नर क्āव्य सिÈत को ल ्āìघै॥ २९७ ॥

Technique:
1. Keep knees on top of one another and heels to opposite hips.
2. Place hands on feet and hold firmly.
3. Keep spine straight and gaze to third eye.
Visualization: Shiva has blessed you to move beyond all material needs and desires
Sanskrit Verse:
prathama jīvaṇo pāva ucāve ḍāī jaṅgha upari kari lyāve |
ḍāī pākhatī tāko āne goḍāṃ upara tala kari ṭhane |
pagathaliyā bāharakī kaura dharantī ṭeke rākhai jora || 246 ||
tirachī paga aḍhā ju pasāre kūlāṃ eḍayā aṅtara dhārai |
mūṅḍa hātha unamāna su rākhe dou kara pāvana pari dākhai || 247 ||
lāṅka pagathalīkī jo doū ubhai hasta so pakarai soū |
trikuṭī driṣṭi dharai puna dhīra samasarīra rākhai kari thīra || 248 ||
pavana dhāraṇā sahita yo āsana sādhai koya |
sīta vāta kā roga te so nara muktā hoya || 249 ||
Translation: While sitting bring the right leg over the left thigh and place the foot touching the ground. Bring left foot on right side and place it’s heel close to the buttock. Place the hands on feet and hold them firmly. Sit straight and direct the gaze in between eyebrows.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
प्रथम जीवणो पाव उचावेडाई जङ्घ उपǐर कǐर ल्यावे |
डाई पाखती ताको आनेगोडांउपर तल कǐर ठने |
पगथͧलया बाहरकी कौर धरÛती टेके राखैजोर || २४६
||
Ǔतरछी पग अढा जुपसारेकू लांएडया अङ्तर धारै |
मूङ्ड हाथ उनमान सुराखेदोउ कर पावन पǐर दाखै || २४७ ||
लाङ्क पगथलीकी जो दोऊ उभैहस्त सो पकरैसोऊ |
ǒत्रकु टी Ǒद्रिष्ट धरैपुन धीर समसरीर राखैकǐर थीर || २४८ ||
पवन धारणा सǑहत यो आसन साधैकोय |
सीत वात का रोग तेसो नर मुÈता होय || २४९ ||

pavana dhāraṇā sahita yo āsana sādhai koya |
sīta vāta kā roga te so nara muktā hoya || 249 ||
Verse Translation: While sitting bring the right leg over the left thigh and place the foot touching the ground. Bring left foot on right side and place it’s heel close to the buttock. Place the hands on feet and hold them firmly. Sit straight and direct the gaze in between eyebrows.
Sanskrit Verse: प्रथम जीवणो पाव उचावेडाई जङ्घ उपǐर कǐर ल्यावे |
डाई पाखती ताको आनेगोडांउपर तल कǐर ठने |
पगथͧलया बाहरकी कौर धरÛती टेके राखैजोर || २४६
||
Ǔतरछी पग अढा जुपसारेकू लांएडया अङ्तर धारै |
मूङ्ड हाथ उनमान सुराखेदोउ कर पावन पǐर दाखै || २४७ ||
लाङ्क पगथलीकी जो दोऊ उभैहस्त सो पकरैसोऊ |
ǒत्रकु टी Ǒद्रिष्ट धरैपुन धीर समसरीर राखैकǐर थीर || २४८ ||
पवन धारणा सǑहत यो आसन साधैकोय |
सीत वात का रोग तेसो नर मुÈता होय || २४९ ||

Technique:
1. Sit and bend right knee, then wrap arm around it, catching hold of opposite forearm.
2. Bend left knee and keep left heel touching left buttocks.
3. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: *Visualize and control the outgoing breath*
Translation:
jamaṇuṃ paganuṃ ḍhīṃcaṇa jamaṇe hāthanī kākhalīmāṃ rākhī tebhaṇī bhāra daī ḍābe paga ḍhīṃcaṇathī vāḻī tenī eḍī ḍābā ḍhagarāne aḍāḍī gudā adhara rākhī besavuṃ te vāmaśvāsagamanāsana kahevāya che।
- ā āsane besavāthī ḍābī nāsikāmāṃthī śvāsanuṃ āvavuṃjavuṃ thavā lāge che।
ḍābā paganuṃ ḍhīṃcaṇa ḍābā hāthanī kākhalīmāṃ rākhī upara kahela che tethī ūlaṭī rīte ḍābībhaṇa bhāra daīne besavuṃ te dakṣiṇaśvāsagamanāsana kahevāya che
।
ā āsane besavāthī jamaṇī nāsikāmāṃthī śvāsapraśvāsanuṃ javuṃāvavuṃ thavā lāge che।
Sanskrit Verse.1:
जमणुंपगनुंढींचण जमणेहाथनी काखलीमां राखी तेभणी
भार दई डाबेपग ढींचणथी वाळी तेनी एडी डाबा ढगराने
अडाडी गुदा अधर राखी बेसवुंतेवामश्वासगमनासन
कहेवाय छे ।
- आ आसनेबेसवाथी डाबी नाͧसकामांथी श्वासनुं
आववुंजवुंथवा लागेछे ।
डाबा पगनुंढींचण डाबा हाथनी काखलीमां राखी उपर
कहेल छेतेथी ऊलटी रीतेडाबीभण भार दईनेबेसवुंते
दͯक्षिणश्वासगमनासन कहेवाय छे ।
आ आसनेबेसवाथी जमणी नाͧसकामांथी श्वासप्रश्वासनुं
जवुंआववुंथवा लागेछे ।

Asana Number: 348
Asana Name: VAMA SVASA GAMANASANA

2. Bend left knee and keep left heel touching left buttocks.
3. Gaze to nose.
Pranamaya: Recaka Kumbhaka
Bandha: Śambhavi Mudra
Mudra: Mula Bandha
Visualization: *Visualize and control the outgoing breath*
Gaze: To nose
Japa: Om Nithyananda
ParamaShivoham

Technique:
1. Remain sitting on knees with hands on thighs.
2. Keep spine straight.
3. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize and embody the state and space of bravery
Sanskrit Verse:
baṃne paga goṭhaṇathī vāḻīne tenā phaṇu gudānī nīce āḍā rākhīne besavuṃ te dhīrāsana kahevāya che।
daṇiyā dhīrāsana tathā vāmapādadhīrāsana e dhīrāsananā avāṃtarabheda che।
jamaṇe paga gudānī nīce rākhī ḍābo paga ḍhīṃcaṇathī vāḻī tenī pānī ḍhagarāne aḍāḍīne besavuṃ te dakṣiṇāpādadhīrāsana che, ne tenāthī ūlaṭī rīte besavuṃ te vāmapādadhīrāsana che।
Translation: Bending both the legs at the knees, sit with shins under the thighs. Keeping the right leg under the thigh, left leg bent from the knee, heel of the foot touching the butt this is Dakshina Pada Dhirasana. The opposite of this is Vama Pada Dhirasana
Sanskrit Verse.1:
बंनेपग गोठणथी वाळीनेतेना फणुगुदानी नीचे
आडा राखीनेबेसवुंतेधीरासन कहेवाय छे ।
दͨणया धीरासन तथा वामपादधीरासन ए
धीरासनना अवांतरभेद छे ।
जमणेपग गुदानी नीचेराखी डाबो पग ढींचणथी
वाळी तेनी पानी ढगरानेअडाडीनेबेसवुंते
दͯक्षिणापादधीरासन छे, नेतेनाथी ऊलटी रीत बेसवुंतेवामपादधीरासन छे ।
Unnamed: 19:
Asana Number: 344
Asana Name: DHIRASANA
Technique: 1. Remain sitting on knees with hands on thighs.
2. Keep spine straight.
3. Gaze to nose.
Pranamaya: Recaka Kumbhaka
Bandha: Śambhavi Mudra
Mudra: Mula Bandha
Visualization: Visualize and embody the state and space of bravery
Gaze: To nose
Japa: Om Nithyananda
ParamaShivoham
Pramana Source: YogaKaustambhaP.164
Sanskrit Verse (Pramana): baṃne paga goṭhaṇathī vāḻīne tenā phaṇu gudānī nīce āḍā rākhīne besavuṃ te dhīrāsana kahevāya che।
daṇiyā dhīrāsana tathā vāmapādadhīrāsana e dhīrāsananā avāṃtarabheda che।
jamaṇe paga gudānī nīce rākhī ḍābo paga ḍhīṃcaṇathī vāḻī tenī pānī ḍhagarāne aḍāḍīne besavuṃ te dakṣiṇāpādadhīrāsana che, ne tenāthī ūlaṭī rīte besavuṃ te vāmapādadhīrāsana che।
Verse Translation: Bending both the legs at the knees, sit with shins under the thighs. Keeping the right leg under the thigh, left leg bent from the knee, heel of the foot touching the butt this is Dakshina Pada Dhirasana. The opposite of this is Vama Pada Dhirasana

धीरासनना अवांतरभेद छे ।
जमणेपग गुदानी नीचेराखी डाबो पग ढींचणथी

दͯक्षिणापादधीरासन छे, नेतेनाथी ऊलटी रीत बेसवुंतेवामपादधीरासन छे ।

Technique:
1. Sit and bend left knee, then wrap arm around it, catching hold of opposite forearm.
2. Bend right knee and keep right heel touching left buttocks.
3. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: *Visualize and control the outgoing breath*
Sanskrit Verse:
jamaṇuṃ paganuṃ ḍhīṃcaṇa jamaṇe hāthanī kākhalīmāṃ rākhī tebhaṇī bhāra daī ḍābe paga ḍhīṃcaṇathī vāḻī tenī eḍī ḍābā ḍhagarāne aḍāḍī gudā adhara rākhī besavuṃ te vāmaśvāsagamanāsana kahevāya che।
- ā āsane besavāthī ḍābī nāsikāmāṃthī śvāsanuṃ āvavuṃjavuṃ thavā lāge che।
ḍābā paganuṃ ḍhīṃcaṇa ḍābā hāthanī kākhalīmāṃ rākhī upara kahela che tethī ūlaṭī rīte ḍābībhaṇa bhāra daīne besavuṃ te dakṣiṇaśvāsagamanāsana kahevāya che।
ā āsane besavāthī jamaṇī nāsikāmāṃthī śvāsapraśvāsanuṃ javuṃāvavuṃ thavā lāge che।
Translation: Bending both the legs at the knees, sit with shins under the thighs. Keeping the right leg under the thigh, left leg bent from the knee, heel of the foot touching the butt this is Dakshina Pada Dhirasana. The opposite of this is Vama Pada Dhirasan
Sanskrit Verse.1:
जमणुंपगनुंढींचण जमणेहाथनी काखलीमां राखी तेभणी
भार दई डाबेपग ढींचणथी वाळी तेनी एडी डाबा ढगराने
अडाडी गुदा अधर राखी बेसवुंतेवामश्वासगमनासन
कहेवाय छे ।
- आ आसनेबेसवाथी डाबी नाͧसकामांथी श्वासनुंआववुंजवुं
थवा लागेछे ।
डाबा पगनुंढींचण डाबा हाथनी काखलीमां राखी उपर कहेल
छेतेथी ऊलटी रीतेडाबीभण भार दईनेबेसवुंते
दͯक्षिणश्वासगमनासन कहेवाय छे ।
आ आसनेबेसवाथी जमणी नाͧसकामांथी श्वासप्रश्वासनुं
जवुंआववुंथवा लागेछ

जमणेपग गुदानी नीचेराखी डाबो पग ढींचणथी
वाळी तेनी पानी ढगरानेअडाडीनेबेसवुंते
दͯक्षिणापादधीरासन छे, नेतेनाथी ऊलटी रीते
बेसवुंतेवामपादधीरासन छे ।
Unnamed: 19:
Asana Number: 347
Asana Name: Vama pada dhirasan
Technique: 1. Remain sitting on knees with hands on thighs.
2. Keep the left leg under the thigh and right leg knee bent, heel touching butt.
3. Gaze to third eye.
Pranamaya: Recaka Kumbhaka
Bandha: Śambhavi Mudra
Mudra: Mula Bandha
Visualization: *Embody the state and space of bravery
control the outgoing breath*
Gaze: Third eye
Japa: Om Nithyananda
ParamaShivoham
Pramana Source: YogaKaustambhaP.164
Sanskrit Verse (Pramana): 
Verse Translation: baṃne paga goṭhaṇathī vāḻīne tenā phaṇu gudānī nīce āḍā rākhīne besavuṃ te dhīrāsana kahevāya che।
daṇiyā dhīrāsana tathā vāmapādadhīrāsana e dhīrāsananā avāṃtarabheda che।
jamaṇe paga gudānī nīce rākhī ḍābo paga ḍhīṃcaṇathī vāḻī tenī pānī ḍhagarāne aḍāḍīne besavuṃ te dakṣiṇāpādadhīrāsana che, ne tenāthī ūlaṭī rīte besavuṃ te vāmapādadhīrāsana che।
Sanskrit Verse: बंनेपग गोठणथी वाळीनेतेना फणुगुदानी नीचे
आडा राखीनेबेसवुंतेधीरासन कहेवाय छे ।
दͨणया धीरासन तथा वामपादधीरासन ए
धीरासनना अवांतरभेद छे ।
जमणेपग गुदानी नीचेराखी डाबो पग ढींचणथी
वाळी तेनी पानी ढगरानेअडाडीनेबेसवुंते
दͯक्षिणापादधीरासन छे, नेतेनाथी ऊलटी रीते
बेसवुंतेवामपादधीरासन छे ।

Technique:
1. Place soles of the feet on ground with knees against the chest. 2. Wrap right arm around raised knees, twist to the right, clasp hands behind back.
3. Gaze to third eye.
Visualization: *Visualize yourself bound by a noose of integrity. A means to keep your emotions integrated, aligned to your purpose.
Sanskrit Verse:
pādatale bhūmaunidhāya jānuni urasi nidhāya viparīta hastābhyāṃ
urusahita jaṃghe nibadhya tiṣṭhet paśāsanaṃ bhavati ॥61॥
Translation: Placing the soles of the feet on the ground and keeping the knees against the chest hold by two hands in a reversed manner the shanks and the thighs jointly and stay. This is called Pasasana.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
पादतलेभूमौǓनधाय जानुǓन उरͧस Ǔनधाय
ͪवपरीत हस्ताभ्यां
उरुसǑहत जंघेǓनबÚय Ǔतष्ठेत ्पशासनं
भवǓत ॥६१

Technique:
1. Cross legs behind and press perineum with raised heel.
2. Place hands on knees.
3. Gaze to nose
Visualization: Visualize and embody the space and state of a lion
Sanskrit Verse:
sīvanīṃ gulphadeśebhyo nipīḍya vyutkrameṇa tu |
prasārya jānunorhastāvāsanaṃ siṃharūpakam || 44 ||
Translation: Pressing the frenum of the prepuce in the reverse order with the ankles, and outstretching the hands placed on the knees, is the posture of the form of the lion (Simha-rupakasana)
Sanskrit Verse.1:
स ्īवन ्īṃ गुल्फदेśएभ्यो Ǔनप ्īḍय
व्युत्क्रमेṇअ तु।
प्रस ्āयर्णज ्āनुनोहर्णस्त ्āव ्āसनṃ ͧसṃहर्ūपकम ्॥ ४४ ॥

Technique:
1. Keep legs cross behind and feet behind opposite knees.
2. Sit perineum down between heels.
3. Rest hands on knees.
4. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: *Visualizing sitting in the space of Upanishad with The SPH
Sanskrit Verse:
jānūrvorantare pādau kṛtvā pādau ca gopayet ।
pādopari ca saṃsthāpya gudaṃ guptāsanaṃ viduḥ ॥20 ॥
Translation: Keep both feet hidden in the middle portion of both the knees and bring the anal region between the feet.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
जानूवर्षोरÛतरेपादौ कृ त्वा पादौ च गोपयेत ्।
पादोपǐर च संस्थाप्य गुदं गुप्तासनंͪवदुः ॥
२१॥

Asana Images: https://i.pinimg.com/736x/c7/bc/91/c7bc91a4e58e70e333e859772c53feef.jpg

Technique:
1. Stand on knees. Bring right toes near left knee, left toes near right knee.
2. Hold the calves behind keeping palms facing backwards (thumbs outside, fingers inside).
3. Gaze to third eye
Visualization: *Visualize and rid yourself of all pain and suffering
Sanskrit Verse:
goḍāṃ vāṅṇo ūbhau hoī goḍā āḍā rākhai doī |
dachi pādake pāṇi rahāvai phaṇau vāma goḍā ḍhigi lyāve || 210 ||
kora vārilī saṅdhi bhū ṭeke eḍī vāmapada saṅdhi vasekhai |
tāmāhī kari bāhari āneṃ vāmapadako phaṇoṃ bhū ṭhane || 211 ||
dou hāthasai aise kare dou nalī pagakī pakaraiṃ |
aṅgulī saba māṃhā ne āneṃ aṅguṣṭa le bāhara ko ṭhāne || 212 ||
sama sarīra nīkāṃ ṭhaharāve dhyāna trikuṭīmadhya lagaāvai |
hoy aṅjukti dhāraṅāmāhī yā āsanasoṃ sabai nasāhī || 213 ||
yā āsana meṃ kijiye vidhiso prāṇanirodha |
vāya gāṅṭhi chūṭe turata ghaṭameṃ upajai bodha || 214 |
Translation: Stand on knees. Bring right toe near the left knee at the back side. Similarly, bring left toe at the back of right knee. Take hold of shanks with hands turning them on backside in such a way that the thumbs come outside and other fingers inside. Fix the gaze between eyebrows
Sanskrit Verse.1:
गोडांवाङ्णो ऊभौ होई गोडा आडा राखैदोई |
दǓछ पादके पाͨण रहावैफणौ वाम गोडा Ǒढͬग ल्यावे || २१० ||
कोर वाǐरली सङ्ͬध भूटेके एडी वामपद सङ्ͬध वसेखै |
तामाही कǐर बाहǐर आनेंवामपदको फण ्ॐ भूठने || २११ ||
दोउ हाथसैऐसेकरेदोउ नली पगकी पकरैं |
अङ्गुली सब मांहा नेआनेंअङ्गुष्ट लेबाहर को ठाने || २१२ ||
सम सरीर नीकांठहरावेÚयान ǒत्रकु टीमÚय लगआवै |
होय ्अङ्जुिÈत धारङामाही या आसनस ्ॐ सबैनसाही || २१३ ||
या आसन मेंͩकिजयेͪवͬधसो प्राणǓनरोध |
वाय गाङ्Ǒठ छू टेतुरत घटमेंउपजैबोध || २१४ ||

2. Hold the calves behind keeping palms facing backwards (thumbs outside, fingers inside).
3. Gaze to third eye

dachi pādake pāṇi rahāvai phaṇau vāma goḍā ḍhigi lyāve || 210 ||
kora vārilī saṅdhi bhū ṭeke eḍī vāmapada saṅdhi vasekhai |
tāmāhī kari bāhari āneṃ vāmapadako phaṇoṃ bhū ṭhane || 211 ||
dou hāthasai aise kare dou nalī pagakī pakaraiṃ |
aṅgulī saba māṃhā ne āneṃ aṅguṣṭa le bāhara ko ṭhāne || 212 ||
sama sarīra nīkāṃ ṭhaharāve dhyāna trikuṭīmadhya lagaāvai |
hoy aṅjukti dhāraṅāmāhī yā āsanasoṃ sabai nasāhī || 213 ||
yā āsana meṃ kijiye vidhiso prāṇanirodha |
vāya gāṅṭhi chūṭe turata ghaṭameṃ upajai bodha || 214 |
Verse Translation: Stand on knees. Bring right toe near the left knee at the back side. Similarly, bring left toe at the back of right knee. Take hold of shanks with hands turning them on backside in such a way that the thumbs come outside and other fingers inside. Fix the gaze between eyebrows
Sanskrit Verse: गोडांवाङ्णो ऊभौ होई गोडा आडा राखैदोई |
दǓछ पादके पाͨण रहावैफणौ वाम गोडा Ǒढͬग ल्यावे || २१० ||
कोर वाǐरली सङ्ͬध भूटेके एडी वामपद सङ्ͬध वसेखै |
तामाही कǐर बाहǐर आनेंवामपदको फण ्ॐ भूठने || २११ ||
दोउ हाथसैऐसेकरेदोउ नली पगकी पकरैं |
अङ्गुली सब मांहा नेआनेंअङ्गुष्ट लेबाहर को ठाने || २१२ ||
सम सरीर नीकांठहरावेÚयान ǒत्रकु टीमÚय लगआवै |
होय ्अङ्जुिÈत धारङामाही या आसनस ्ॐ सबैनसाही || २१३ ||
या आसन मेंͩकिजयेͪवͬधसो प्राणǓनरोध |
वाय गाङ्Ǒठ छू टेतुरत घटमेंउपजैबोध || २१४ ||

Technique: 1. Stand on knees. Bring right toes near left knee, left toes near right knee.
2. Hold the calves behind keeping palms facing backwards (thumbs outside, fingers inside).
3. Gaze to third eye

Technique:
1. Stand on the toes with heels raised, knees gently bent and pointing outwards.
2. Arch the back forward and down keeping hips high.
3. Place hands on the ground in tripataka mudra (all fingers together except ring finger, which is bent)
4. Raise the legs up, inverting the body, keeping the soles facing the sky and chest/head pointed upwards.
Sanskrit Verse: ॥ ūrdhvāṅgulitalau pādau tripatākāvadhomukhau hastau śirassannataṃ ca gaṅgāvataraṇaṃ tviti ॥108॥
Translation: Foot with the toes and sole turned upwards, hands showing tripataka with fingers pointing downwards and the head being sannata.

हस्तौ ͧशरस्सÛनतंच गङ्गावतरणंित्वǓत ॥108

Sanskrit Verse: iti yogāsanasthaśca yogī bhavati sādhakaḥ | narāsanaṃ yaḥ karoti sa siddho nātra saṃśayaḥ ||
Translation:
Thus with the practice of yoga and āsana, the practitioner becomes a yogi.
He who does narāsana becomes a siddha, of this there is no doubt.

Technique:
1. Keep top of head and hands onto mat.
2. With legs raised up towards sky, remove support of hands.
3. Gaze to third eye.
Visualization: *Visualize Paramaśiva encompassing you; keeping you stable and in place
Sanskrit Verse: athāsanaprabhedañca śṛṇu matsiddhikāṅkṣaṇām | yena vinā pūrakāṇāṃ siddhibhāk na mahītale || adho muṇḍāsanaṃ vakṣye sarveṣāṃ prāṇināṃ sukham | ūdrdhvamārge padaṃ dattvā dhārayenmārutaṃ sudhīḥ || sarvāsanānāṃ śreṣṭhaṃ hi ūdrdhvapādo yadā caret | tadaiva mahatīṃ siddhiṃ dadāti vāyavī kalā ||
Translation:
Now listen to the different āsanas that are for those who wish to realize Me (Bhairavi); without them (āsanas), the pūraka (prānāyāma) siddhi cannot be attained in this world. For the well-being and happiness of all living beings, I speak now about adhomundāsanam; the intelligent one should raise legs upwards and by lowering the head hold the vital breath. This (mundāsana) is certainly the supreme among all āsanas, in which the legs are raised upwards. The skill of breath control gives great powers to the practitioner instantly. (23.25)
Stand only on your head without support of hands or shoulders, with legs raised up. Hold the breath in this posture. This is adhomundasan

Sanskrit Verse (Pramana): athāsanaprabhedañca śṛṇu matsiddhikāṅkṣaṇām | yena vinā pūrakāṇāṃ siddhibhāk na mahītale || adho muṇḍāsanaṃ vakṣye sarveṣāṃ prāṇināṃ sukham | ūdrdhvamārge padaṃ dattvā dhārayenmārutaṃ sudhīḥ || sarvāsanānāṃ śreṣṭhaṃ hi ūdrdhvapādo yadā caret | tadaiva mahatīṃ siddhiṃ dadāti vāyavī kalā ||
Verse Translation: Now listen to the different āsanas that are for those who wish to realize Me (Bhairavi); without them (āsanas), the pūraka (prānāyāma) siddhi cannot be attained in this world. This (mundāsana) is certainly the supreme among all āsanas, in which the legs are raised upwards. The skill of breath control gives great powers to the practitioner instantly. (23.25)
Stand only on your head without support of hands or shoulders, with legs raised up. Hold the breath in this posture. This is adhomundasan

Technique:
1. Place both hands down on the ground and press the entire body up. 2. Bring the forehead down and touch it to the ground.
3. Repeat this again and again.
Visualization: *Visualize yourself as a Hawk
Sanskrit Verse:
viparitanṛtya ca sthitau nāsikā bhūmau saṃspṛśya urdhvaṃ nītvā
punaḥ saṃspaśet śyenāsanaṃ bhavati ॥44॥
Translation: Assuming the position of Viparitanrtya touch the ground with the toes (lowering the head downwards) and raise it up (as it was before) again. Do this again and again. This is called Syenasana (the hawk).
Sanskrit Verse.1:

पुनः संस्पशेत ्श्येनासनंभवǓत ॥४४॥

Technique:
1. Stand with feet flat and keep both hands extended up.
2. Keep palms separated.
3. Gaze forward.
Visualization: *Visualize yourself as a Palmyra Tree*
Sanskrit Verse: be hātha ūṃcā karīne paṃja pahoḻā rākhīne ūbhā rahevuṃ te tāḍāsana (tālāsana) kahevāya che। eka eka hātha ūṃce rākhavāthī ardhatāḍāsana thāya che। beśīne paṇa hāthanī upara pramāṇe sthiti rākhavāthī paṇa tāḍāsana thāya che। hāthamāṃ tathā udaramāṃ ā āsanathī bala vadhe che।
Translation: Stand and keep both hands up extended up, keeping the palms spread out is called Tadasana (Talasana). Keeping the hands up one at a time is called Ardha Tadasana. Sitting down with the hands extended up (as described previously) is also called Tadasana. This asana will increase strength in your arms and udar
Sanskrit Verse.1:
बेहाथ ऊं चा करीनेपंज पहोळा राखीनेऊभा
रहेवुंतेताडासन (तालासन) कहेवाय छे । एक
एक हाथ ऊं चेराखवाथी अधर्णताडासन थाय छे
। बेशीनेपण हाथनी उपर प्रमाणेिस्थǓत
राखवाथी पण ताडासन थाय छे । हाथमां
तथा उदरमांआ आसनथी बल वधेछे ।

Technique:
1. Stand tall.
2. Raise arms to the side, parallel to ground.
2. Swing the hands forward in a circular motion.
3. Repeat again and again.
Visualization: *Visualize yourself as a Potter’s Wheel*
Sanskrit Verse: Hastau prasārya bhrāmaṇaṃ kartavyaṃ kulāla cakrāsanaṃ bhavati ॥90 ॥

Technique:

Sanskrit Verse:
ekenapādena bhūmimavaṣṭabhya anyapādatalena uru avaṣṭabhya |
tiṣṭhet āṣṭa iti punaḥ punaḥ kartavyaṃ ardhacaṃdraṃ bhavati ||
Translation: Holding the ground by one foot, place the sole of the other foot against the thigh and stay. Repeat the other side, switching again and again. This is called Ardhacandra.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
एके नपादेन भूͧममवष्टभ्य
अÛयपादतलेन उरु अवष्टभ्य

अधर्णचंद्रं भवǓत ॥ ७८ ॥

Verse Translation: Holding the ground by one foot, place the sole of the other foot against the thigh and stay. Repeat the other side, switching again and again. This is called Ardhacandra.
Sanskrit Verse: एके नपादेन भूͧममवष्टभ्य
अÛयपादतलेन उरु अवष्टभ्य
Ǔतष्ठेत ्आष्ट इǓत पुनः पुनः कतर्णव्यं
अधर्णचंद्रं भवǓत ॥ ७८ ॥

Asana Name: ARDHA CHANDRASANA
Technique: 1. Stand and keep sole of left foot against side of right knee.
2. Bring palms together in front of chest. 3. Gaze to nose.
Pranamaya: Ujjai Kumbhaka

Technique:
1. Bring one heel to opposite hip.
2. Sit and stand again and again, alternating sides.
3. Gaze forward.
Visualization: *Visualize yourself as an Arrow to Shiva’s bow*
Sanskrit Verse:
tiṣṭhansaṃn pārṣiṇanā itara jaghana pradeśe saṃpīḍya sthātavyaṃ
mutthitavayaṃ iti punaḥ punaḥ kartavyaṃ śaṃvkāsanaṃ bhavati ॥79॥
Translation: Pressing by one heel on the other hip be sitting and standing alternately again and again. This is called Sankvasana. (Arrow posture)
Sanskrit Verse.1:
Ǔतष्ठÛसंन ्पाͪषर्णणना इतर जघन प्रदेशे

मुित्थतवयंइǓत पुनः पुनः कतर्णव्यंशंव्कासनं
भवǓत ॥७९॥

Technique:
1. Stand with spine straight, one hand raised up above the head.
2. Gaze forward.
Visualization: *Visualize yourself as a Palmyra Tree*
Sanskrit Verse: be hātha ūṃcā karīne paṃja pahoḻā rākhīne ūbhā rahevuṃ te tāḍāsana (tālāsana) kahevāya che। eka eka hātha ūṃce rākhavāthī ardhatāḍāsana thāya che। beśīne paṇa hāthanī upara pramāṇe sthiti rākhavāthī paṇa tāḍāsana thāya che। hāthamāṃ tathā udaramāṃ ā āsanathī bala vadhe che।
Translation: Stand and keep both hands up extended up, keeping the palms spread out is called Tadasana (Talasana). Keeping the hands up one at a time is called Ardha Tadasana. Sitting down with the hands extended up (as described previously) is also called Tadasana. This asana will increase strength in your arms and udar.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
बेहाथ ऊं चा करीनेपंज पहोळा राखीनेऊभा
रहेवुंतेताडासन (तालासन) कहेवाय छे । एक
एक हाथ ऊं चेराखवाथी अधर्णताडासन थाय छे
। बेशीनेपण हाथनी उपर प्रमाणेिस्थǓत
राखवाथी पण ताडासन थाय छे । हाथमां
तथा उदरमांआ आसनथी बल वधेछे ।

Mudra: Mula Bandha

Gaze: Forward

ParamaShivoham

Technique:
1. Stand tall and step left foot backwards. 2. Bend right leg and bring thigh parallel to ground.
3. Extend arms out in front and behind.
4. Gaze forward.
Visualization: *Visualize yourself as Lord Virabhadra*
Sanskrit Verse:
uttānapādaṃ krauñcaṃ ca marīciṃ vīrabhadrakam ।
naṭarājaṃ trikoṇaṃ ca suptāṅgaṣṭhaprasāraṇe ॥
Translation: (Examples of best asanas are) Uttanapadasana, Krauncasana, Maricyasana, Virabhadrasana, Natarajasana, Trikonasana, Supta padangusthasana and Supta prasarita padangustasana
Sanskrit Verse.1:
उत्तानपादं क्रौञ्चंच मरीͬच ंवीरभद्रकम ्।
नटराजंǒत्रकोणंच सुप्ताङ्गष्ठप्रसारणे॥

Technique:
1. From Virabhadrasana, hinge forward, bringing right hand down inside of the right leg.
2. Left heels stay on ground.
3. Open up chest and bring left arm up straight.
4. Gaze towards sky
Visualization: *Visualize Swamiji, The SPH
Sanskrit Verse:
saptacakrakṣālanāya vṛkṣāsanaviśeṣakān |
jananendriyadārḍhyāya koṇabhedān samabhyaset ||
Translation:
For cleaning the seven chakras, Vrksasana is considered very special. And for strengthening the reproductive organs, different variations of konasana must be practiced.
(Konasana includes: Trikonasana, parsva konasana, upavista konasana, supta konasana, viparitya konasana and urdhva konasana.)
Sanskrit Verse.1:
सप्तचक्रक्षिालनाय वृक्षिासनͪवशेषकान ् ।
जननेिÛद्रयदाɭर्णयाय कोणभेदान ्समभ्यसेत ्
॥

4. Gaze towards sky

Technique:
1. From Parivrtta Trikonasana, rise up and step forward onto right foot.
2. Extend left leg backwards, and both arms forwards, limbs parallel to ground.
3. Gaze down towards ground.
Visualization: *Visualize yourself as Lord Virabhadra*
Sanskrit Verse:
uttānapādaṃ krauñcaṃ ca marīciṃ vīrabhadrakam ।
naṭarājaṃ trikoṇaṃ ca suptāṅgaṣṭhaprasāraṇe ॥
Translation: (Examples of best asanas are) Uttanapadasana, Krauncasana, Maricyasana, Virabhadrasana, Natarajasana, Trikonasana, Supta padangusthasana and Supta prasarita padangustasana.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
उत्तानपादं क्रौञ्चंच मरीͬच ंवीरभद्रकम ्।
नटराजंǒत्रकोणंच सुप्ताङ्गष्ठप्रसारणे॥
Unnamed: 19:
Asana Number: 378
Asana Name: VIRABHADRASANA 3
Technique: 1. From Parivrtta Trikonasana, rise up and step forward onto right foot.
2. Extend left leg backwards, and both arms forwards, limbs parallel to ground.
3. Gaze down towards ground.
Pranamaya: Ujjai Kumbhaka
Bandha: Shambavi Mudra
Mudra: Mula Bandha
Visualization: *Visualize yourself as Lord Virabhadra*
Gaze: Forward
Japa: Om Nithyananda
ParamaShivoham
Pramana Source: Nathamuni'sYogaRahasya

Technique:
1. From Virabhadrasana, rise up, keep both legs straight.
2. Raise left foot up parallel to ground, toes pointed upwards. 3. Keep hands by the sides.
4. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: *Visualize Swamiji, The SPH
Sanskrit Verse:
jamaṇe paga pūrvabhaṇī (jemaṇe āpaṇuṃ māṃ hoya tebhaṇī) bābo karī ḍābe page ūbhā rahevuṃ te vāmapādāsana kahevāya che।
ḍābo paga pūrvabhaṇī lāṃbo karī jamaṇe page ūbhā rahevuṃ te dakṣiṇapādāsana kahevāya che।
Translation: Lift the right leg striaght towards East (or whatever way you're facing) and then stand on the left foot. This is Vama Padasana. Lifting the opposite left leg up towards East (or whatever way you're facing) and standing on the right leg, is Dakshina Padasana.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
जमणेपग पूवर्णभणी (जेमणेआपणुंमांहोय
तेभणी) बाबो करी डाबेपगेऊभा रहेवुंते
वामपादासन कहेवाय छे ।
डाबो पग पूवर्णभणी लांबो करी जमणेपगे
ऊभा रहेवुंतेदͯक्षिणपादासन कहेवाय छे ।

Bandha: Shambavi Mudra

Visualization: *Visualize Swamiji, The SPH
Gaze: To Nose
Japa: Om Nithyananda

Technique:
1. Stand and keep sole of left foot against side of right knee.
2. Bring palms together in front of chest. 3. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: *Visualize yourself as a tree
Sanskrit Verse:
ardhavṛkṣāsana e ā āsanane avāṃtarabheda che।
baṃne paga ḍhīṃcaṇathī vāḻī māthuṃ bhūmithī ṭekāvī ūṃdhe mastake karavuṃ te ardhavṛkṣāsana kahevāya che।
vāma ūnā mūlamāṃ jamaṇā pagane rākhīne ūbhā rahevuṃ te matāṃtaranuṃ vṛkṣāsana kahevāya che।
Translation: Stand up keeping the right leg at the mula of vama uru is called Vrksasana of Matantara (Mantantara Vrksasana)
Sanskrit Verse.1:
अधर्णवृक्षिासन ए आ आसननेअवांतरभेद छे ।
बंनेपग ढींचणथी वाळी माथुंभूͧमथी टेकावी
ऊं धेमस्तके करवुंतेअधर्णवृक्षिासन कहेवाय छे
।
वाम ऊना मूलमांजमणा पगनेराखीनेऊभा
रहेवुंतेमतांतरनुंवृक्षिासन कहेवाय छ

Technique:
1. Stand and bring left foot to right hip.
2. Bend down and touch the little fingers to the ground.
3. Gaze to nose.

Sanskrit Verse: nitambe ca pādagoṣṭhī hastābhyāmaṅgulīyakam | atha kāmāsanaṃ vakṣye kāmasaṅgena hetunā ||
Translation: Having assumed Garudasana, balance the buttocks, and feet by touching the tips of little fingers of both the hands to the ground.

Technique:
1. Place left foot above right knee.
2. Bend down on right foot and keep hips at the level of the knee.
3. Hands on respective thighs.
4. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as an ancient Hindu aircraft; capable of crossing into different dimensions
Sanskrit Verse:
ekaṃ pādaṃ bhūmaunidhāya nitaṃbaṃ jānupradeśe ānīya dvitiyaṃpādaṃ
janunīnidhāya tiṣṭhet vimānāsanaṃ bhavati ॥76॥
Translation: Placing one foot on the ground keep the hips at the level of the knees and keep the second foot on the knee and stay. This is called Vimanasana.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
एकं पादं भूमौǓनधाय Ǔनतंबंजानुप्रदेशे
आनीय द्ͪवǓतयंपादं
जनुनीǓनधाय Ǔतष्ठेत ्ͪवमानासनंभवǓत ॥
७६॥

Sanskrit Verse: Not Available
Translation: Stand up and keep the sole of the left foot touching the left side of the right knee. This is called Ardha-Padmasana. Changing to the opposite way can be done. This is a variation of Purna-Padasana, which is standing up with both the legs
Sanskrit Verse.1:
ऊभा रहीनेडाबा पगनेफण जमणा पगना
ढींचणना उत्तरना (डाबे) भागमांअडाडी
राखवेतेअधर्णपादासन कहेवाय छे ।
पगेनी िस्थǓत बदलवाथी आ आसननेबीजो
भेद थाय छे । पूणर्णपादासन ए आ आसननो
अवांतरभेद छे । बंनेपगेऊभा रहेवुंते
पूणर्णपादासन कहेवाय छे ।

Technique: 1. Stand and keep sole of left foot against side of right knee.
2. Bring palms together in front of chest. 3. Gaze to nose.
Pranamaya: Ujjai Kumbhaka
Bandha: Anjali Mudra
Mudra: Mula Bandha
Visualization: *Visualize Swamiji, The SPH
Gaze: To Nose
Japa: Om Nithyananda
ParamaShivoham
Pramana Source: YogaKaustumbhaP.169
Sanskrit Verse (Pramana): Not Available
Verse Translation: Stand up and keep the sole of the left foot touching the left side of the right knee. This is called Ardha-Padmasana. Changing to the opposite way can be done. This is a variation of Purna-Padasana, which is standing up with both the legs
Sanskrit Verse: ऊभा रहीनेडाबा पगनेफण जमणा पगना
ढींचणना उत्तरना (डाबे) भागमांअडाडी
राखवेतेअधर्णपादासन कहेवाय छे ।
पगेनी िस्थǓत बदलवाथी आ आसननेबीजो
भेद थाय छे । पूणर्णपादासन ए आ आसननो
अवांतरभेद छे । बंनेपगेऊभा रहेवुंते
पूणर्णपादासन कहेवाय छे ।

Technique:
. Stand on left leg and hold onto right foot with both hands.
2. Keep both legs straight and raise right leg up towards head.

Sanskrit Verse: uttānakūrmapithaí ca saiṁhas gārudameva ca | vātāyanaṁ gomukhaṁ ca bhāradvājaṁ trivikramam ||
Translation: (Examples of the best asanas are) Uttāna Kūrmasana, Simhāsana, Garudāsana, Vātāyanāsa, Gomukhāsana, Bhāradvājāsana and Trivikramāsana.

गण्डभेरुण्डसǑहतेशीषर्णदण्डासनंतथा ॥

Technique:
॥ añcitaḥ pṛṣṭhataḥ pādaḥ kuñcitordhvatalāṅguliḥ
latākhyaśca karo vāmastallatāvṛścikaṃ bhavet ॥44॥
Translation:
A foot to be in anchita and turned backwards, the left hand to be with lata gesture its palm and fingers bent and turned upwards.
One foot to be behind the back, with heel resting and Anchita: heels on the ground, forepart of the feet raised and all the toes spread.
Lata hasta: the two hands to be obliquely stretched sideways.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
॥ अिञ्चतः पृष्ठतः पादः कु िञ्चतोÚवर्णतलाङ्गुͧलः
लताख्यश्च करो वामस्तल्लतावृिश्चकं भवेत ्॥44॥

Technique:
1. Stand with spine straight, one hand raised up above the head.
2. Gaze forward.
Visualization: *Visualize yourself as a Palmyra Tree*
Translation: be hātha ūṃcā karīne paṃja pahoḻā rākhīne ūbhā rahevuṃ te tāḍāsana (tālāsana) kahevāya che। eka eka hātha ūṃce rākhavāthī ardhatāḍāsana thāya che। beśīne paṇa hāthanī upara pramāṇe sthiti rākhavāthī paṇa tāḍāsana thāya che। hāthamāṃ tathā udaramāṃ ā āsanathī bala vadhe che।
Sanskrit Verse.1:
बेहाथ ऊं चा करीनेपंज पहोळा राखीनेऊभा
रहेवुंतेताडासन (तालासन) कहेवाय छे । एक
एक हाथ ऊं चेराखवाथी अधर्णताडासन थाय छे
। बेशीनेपण हाथनी उपर प्रमाणेिस्थǓत
राखवाथी पण ताडासन थाय छे । हाथमां
तथा उदरमांआ आसनथी बल वधेछे ।

Technique:
1. Stand tall and step right foot backwards. 2. Bend left leg and bring thigh parallel to ground.
3. Extend arms out in front and behind.
4. Gaze forward.
Visualization: *Visualize yourself as Lord Virabhadra*
Sanskrit Verse:
uttānapādaṃ krauñcaṃ ca marīciṃ vīrabhadrakam ।
naṭarājaṃ trikoṇaṃ ca suptāṅgaṣṭhaprasāraṇe ॥
Translation: (Examples of best asanas are) Uttanapadasana, Krauncasana, Maricyasana, Virabhadrasana, Natarajasana, Trikonasana, Supta padangusthasana and Supta prasarita padangustasana.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
उत्तानपादं क्रौञ्चंच मरीͬच ंवीरभद्रकम ्।
नटराजंǒत्रकोणंच सुप्ताङ्गष्ठप्रसारणे॥

॥

Technique:
1. Stand and keep sole of left foot against side of right knee.
2. Bring palms together in front of chest. 3. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as a tree*
Sanskrit Verse:
ardhavṛkṣāsana e ā āsanane avāṃtarabheda che।
baṃne paga ḍhīṃcaṇathī vāḻī māthuṃ bhūmithī ṭekāvī ūṃdhe mastake karavuṃ te ardhavṛkṣāsana kahevāya che।
vāma ūnā mūlamāṃ jamaṇā pagane rākhīne ūbhā rahevuṃ te matāṃtaranuṃ vṛkṣāsana kahevāya che।
Translation: Stand up keeping the right leg at the mula of vama uru is called Vrksasana of Matantara (Mantantara Vrksasana)
Sanskrit Verse.1:
अधर्णवृक्षिासन ए आ आसननेअवांतरभेद छे ।
बंनेपग ढींचणथी वाळी माथुंभूͧमथी टेकावी
ऊं धेमस्तके करवुंतेअधर्णवृक्षिासन कहेवाय छे
।
वाम ऊना मूलमांजमणा पगनेराखीनेऊभा
रहेवुंतेमतांतरनुंवृक्षिासन कहेवाय छे ।

Asana Number: 391

Pranamaya: Ujjai Kumbhaka
Bandha: Shambavi Mudra

Visualization: Visualize yourself as a tree*
Gaze: To Nose
Japa: Om Nithyananda
ParamaShivoham

Technique:
1. Stand and bring right foot to left hip.
2. Bend down and touch the little fingers to the ground.
3. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: *Embody pure, unconditional love*
Sanskrit Verse: nitambe ca pādagoṣṭhī hastābhyāmaṅgulīyakam | atha kāmāsanaṃ vakṣye kāmasaṅgena hetunā ||
Translation: Having assumed Garudasana, balance the buttocks, and feet by touching the tips of little fingers of both the hands to the ground.

१९ ॥

Sanskrit Verse:
ekaṃ pādaṃ bhūmaunidhāya nitaṃbaṃ jānupradeśe ānīya dvitiyaṃpādaṃ
janunīnidhāya tiṣṭhet vimānāsanaṃ bhavati ॥76॥

Sanskrit Verse.1:
ऊभा रहीनेडाबा पगनेफण जमणा पगना
ढींचणना उत्तरना (डाबे) भागमांअडाडी
राखवेतेअधर्णपादासन कहेवाय छे ।
पगेनी िस्थǓत बदलवाथी आ आसननेबीजो
भेद थाय छे । पूणर्णपादासन ए आ आसननो
अवांतरभेद छे । बंनेपगेऊभा रहेवुंते
पूणर्णपादासन कहेवाय छे ।

Technique:
॥ añcitaḥ pṛṣṭhataḥ pādaḥ kuñcitordhvatalāṅguliḥ
latākhyaśca karo vāmastallatāvṛścikaṃ bhavet ॥44॥
Translation:
A foot to be in anchita and turned backwards, the left hand to be with lata gesture its palm and fingers bent and turned upwards.
One foot to be behind the back, with heel resting and Anchita: heels on the ground, forepart of the feet raised and all the toes spread.
Lata hasta: the two hands to be obliquely stretched sideways.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
॥ अिञ्चतः पृष्ठतः पादः कु िञ्चतोÚवर्णतलाङ्गुͧलः
लताख्यश्च करो वामस्तल्लतावृिश्चकं भवेत ्॥44॥

Technique:
1. From kneeling position, place both hands on ground, fingers pointed backwards.
2. Bring elbows together at the navel.
3. Slowly lift entire body off the ground, keeping legs and upper body parallel to ground.
4. Bring right leg over top of right shoulder and hold.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as a Peacock
Sanskrit Verse:
atha piṇḍamayūrāsanam ---
ekaṃ pādaṃ mayūrāgre prasāryaikaṃ mayūravat ।
idaṃ piṇḍamayūrākhyaṃ sarvavyādhivināśakam ॥46॥
Translation: Stretch one leg in front and the other stretched out like a peacock. This is pinda-mayura, which cures all the ailments.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
अथ ͪपÖडमयूरासनम ् ---
एकं पादं मयूराग्रेप्रसायर्यैकं मयूरवत ्।
इदं ͪपÖडमयूराख्यंसवर्ध्वव्याͬधͪवनाशकम ्॥४६

Visualization: Visualize yourself as a Peacock

Sanskrit Verse:
vāsişthamathakaundinyamūrdh
vakukkutameva ca |
astavakramathottānamayūram setubandhanam |
uttānapādam krauñcar ca marícií vīrabhadrakaṁ | natarājam trikonaṁ ca suptānguşthaprasārane ||
Translation: (Examples of best asanas are) Vasisthāsana, Kaundinyāsana, Urdhvakukkutāsana, Aştāvakrāsana, Uttāna mayūrāsana, Setubandhāsana, Uttanapadāsana, Krauncāsana, Marleyāsana, Virabhadrāsana, Varajāsana, Trikonāsana, Supta Pādangusthāsana and Supta Prasarita Pādānguşthāsana
Sanskrit Verse.1:
वाͧसष्ठमथकौिण्डÛयमूÚवर्णकु Èकु टमेव च ।
अष्टावक्रमथोत्तानमयूर सेतुबÛधनम ्।
उत्तानपादं क्रौञ्च च मरीͬच ंवीरभद्रकम ्।
नटराज ǒत्रकोणंच सुप्ताङ्गुष्ठप्रसारणे॥

1. Spread the legs out sideways.
2. Lean chest forward and down onto ground.
3. Reach and hold the feet while resting chin on ground.
4. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize Swamiji, The SPH
Sanskrit Verse:
saptacakrakṣālanāya vṛkṣāsanaviśeṣakān |
jananendriyadārḍhyāya koṇabhedān samabhyaset ||
Translation:
For cleaning the seven chakras, Vrksasana is considered very special. And for strengthening the reproductive organs, different variations of konasana must be practiced.
(Konasana includes: Trikonasana, parsva konasana, upavista konasana, supta konasana, viparitya konasana and urdhva konasana.)
Sanskrit Verse.1:
सप्तचक्रक्षिालनाय वृक्षिासनͪवशेषकान ् ।
जननेिÛद्रयदाɭर्णयाय कोणभेदान ्समभ्यसेत ्
॥

4. Gaze to nose.
Pranamaya: Rechaka Kumbhaka
Bandha: Shambavi Mudra

Visualization: Visualize Swamiji, The SPH

Technique:
1. Sit and cross arms holding opposite big toes (left hand on top of right).
2. Keep right leg extended straight and pull right foot to right ear. 3. Gaze forward.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as the arrow to Shiva’s bow
Sanskrit Verse:
pādāṁguṣṭhau tu pāṇibhyāṁ
gṛhitvā śravaṇāvadhi ॥
dhanurākarṣaṇaṁ kṛtvā dhanurāsanamucyate ॥ 11 ॥
Translation: The big toes are caught with the hands and are pulled up to the ears. Thus one assumes the shape of a stretched bow. This is called dhanurasana
Sanskrit Verse.1:
पादांगुष्ठौ तुपाͨणभ्यांगृǑहत्वा श्रवणावͬध॥
धनुराकषर्णणंकृ त्वा धनुरासनमुच्यते॥ ११॥

Technique:
1. Sit and keep the right leg on left thigh.
2. Let palms rest on one another 3. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize and embody the state and space of Bravery
Sanskrit Verse:
dviguṇaṁ patitaṁ pādam vāmam dakṣiṇatotthitam |
kṛtvā'nyonyatalasṭhaṁ tu vīrapaṭṭamathocyate ॥ 9 ॥
Translation: Placing the left leg on the right thigh and keeping the right leg on a pedestal or on the floor and keeping the palms on one another. Virasana can be assumed.

Technique:
1. Sit and lift right leg behind head.
2. Keep left leg extended straight.
3. Bring palms together in front of chest 4. Gaze to third eye.
Visualization: Visualize Swamiji, The SPH
Sanskrit Verse:
ekapādamatho kaṇṭhe utthāpyaikaṃ ca daṇḍavat ||
karau sampuṭitau kṛtvā ekapādaṃ taducyate || 64 ||
Translation: Having placed one leg over the neck, the other leg is raised up like a stick. Then hands are folded on the chest. This is called ekapada.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
एकपादमथो कण्ठेउत्थाप्यैकं च दण्डवत ् ||
करौ सम्पुǑटतौ कृ त्वा एकपादं तदुच्यत || ६४ ||

Mudra: Mula Bandha
Visualization: Visualize Swamiji, The SPH
Gaze: Third eye

Technique:
1. Sit and keep right leg behind head.
2. Bring left heel to perineum.
3. Keep palms together in front of chest. 4. Gaze to third eye.
Visualization: Visualize Swamiji, The SPH
Sanskrit Verse:
besīne baṃne paga māthāupara lāvī ḍākanā pāchalyā bhāga para caḍhāvavā ne hātha joḍīne sthiti karavī te dvipādaśīrṣāsana kahevāya che। ā āsananā viśeṣa spaṣṭīkaraṇamāṭe pariśiṣṭamāṃ āpeluṃ ā āsananuṃ citra juo। keī yogīo ā āsanane pāśinīmudrā paṇa kahe che, ne āvī sthiti rākhī baṃne karatale pṛthvī para rākhīne śarīrane ūpāḍavāne vajelī mudrā kahe che। ā āsana kuṃḍalinīne prabodha karanāra tathā biṃdune jya karanāruṃ che।
vāmapādaśīrṣāsana tathā dakṣiṇapādaśīrṣāsana e ānā avāṃtarabheda che। ā āsano karatī velā baṃne hāthathī pagane paṃjo pakaḍa। - besīne ḍābo paga māthāupara caḍhāva te vāmapādaśīrṣāsana kahevāya che, ne besīne jamaṇe paga māthāupara caḍhāve te dakṣiṇapādaśīrṣāsana kahevāya che।
Translation: Sitting down, bring both legs behind your neck and palms together at the chest. This is Dvipadasirsasana. Some Yogis also call this asana Pasinimudra. In this posture, putting both your hands on the ground, and lifting up your body, is known as Vajrolimudrasana. This asana is used to awaken the Kundalini and Ajna Chakra, making your victorious over the Bindu. Sitting down and lifting the left leg on your head is Vamapada-sirsasana and lifting the right leg behind the head is Dakshinapada-sirsasana, two variations of this posture. Before doing these asanas, use both your hands and touch the base of the feet (stretch)
Sanskrit Verse.1:
बेसीनेबंनेपग माथाउपर लावी डाकना पाछल्या भाग पर चढाववा ने
हाथ जोडीनेिस्थǓत करवी तेद्ͪवपादशीषार्णसन कहेवाय छे । आ
आसनना ͪवशेष स्पष्टीकरणमाटेपǐरͧशष्टमांआपेलुंआ आसननुं
ͬचत्र जुओ। के ई योगीओ आ आसननेपाͧशनीमुद्रा पण कहेछे, ने
आवी िस्थǓत राखी बंनेकरतलेपृथ्वी पर राखीनेशरीरनेऊपाडवाने
वजेली मुद्रा कहेछे । आ आसन कुं डͧलनीनेप्रबोध करनार तथा ǒब ंदुने
ज्य करनारुं छे ।
वामपादशीषार्णसन तथा दͯक्षिणपादशीषार्णसन ए आना अवांतरभेद छे ।
आ आसनो करती वेला बंनेहाथथी पगनेपंजो पकड। - बेसीनेडाबो
पग माथाउपर चढाव तेवामपादशीषार्णसन कहेवाय छे, नेबेसीने
जमणेपग माथाउपर चढावेतेदͯक्षिणपादशीषार्णसन कहेवाय छे ।

Technique: 1. Sit and keep right leg behind head.
2. Bring left heel to perineum.
3. Keep palms together in front of chest. 4. Gaze to third eye.
Pranamaya: Pratyahara Kumbhaka
Bandha: Anjali Mudra
Mudra: Mula Bandha
Visualization: Visualize Swamiji, The SPH
Gaze: Third eye
Japa: Om Nithyananda
ParamaShivoham

vāmapādaśīrṣāsana tathā dakṣiṇapādaśīrṣāsana e ānā avāṃtarabheda che। ā āsano karatī velā baṃne hāthathī pagane paṃjo pakaḍa। - besīne ḍābo paga māthāupara caḍhāva te vāmapādaśīrṣāsana kahevāya che, ne besīne jamaṇe paga māthāupara caḍhāve te dakṣiṇapādaśīrṣāsana kahevāya che।
Verse Translation: Sitting down, bring both legs behind your neck and palms together at the chest. This is Dvipadasirsasana. Some Yogis also call this asana Pasinimudra. In this posture, putting both your hands on the ground, and lifting up your body, is known as Vajrolimudrasana. This asana is used to awaken the Kundalini and Ajna Chakra, making your victorious over the Bindu. Sitting down and lifting the left leg on your head is Vamapada-sirsasana and lifting the right leg behind the head is Dakshinapada-sirsasana, two variations of this posture. Before doing these asanas, use both your hands and touch the base of the feet (stretch)
Sanskrit Verse: बेसीनेबंनेपग माथाउपर लावी डाकना पाछल्या भाग पर चढाववा ने
हाथ जोडीनेिस्थǓत करवी तेद्ͪवपादशीषार्णसन कहेवाय छे । आ
आसनना ͪवशेष स्पष्टीकरणमाटेपǐरͧशष्टमांआपेलुंआ आसननुं
ͬचत्र जुओ। के ई योगीओ आ आसननेपाͧशनीमुद्रा पण कहेछे, ने
आवी िस्थǓत राखी बंनेकरतलेपृथ्वी पर राखीनेशरीरनेऊपाडवाने
वजेली मुद्रा कहेछे । आ आसन कुं डͧलनीनेप्रबोध करनार तथा ǒब ंदुने
ज्य करनारुं छे ।
वामपादशीषार्णसन तथा दͯक्षिणपादशीषार्णसन ए आना अवांतरभेद छे ।
आ आसनो करती वेला बंनेहाथथी पगनेपंजो पकड। - बेसीनेडाबो
पग माथाउपर चढाव तेवामपादशीषार्णसन कहेवाय छे, नेबेसीने
जमणेपग माथाउपर चढावेतेदͯक्षिणपादशीषार्णसन कहेवाय छे ।

Technique:
1. From kneeling position, place both hands on ground, fingers pointed backwards.
2. Bring elbows together at the navel.
3. Slowly lift entire body off the ground, keeping legs and upper body parallel to ground.
4. Bring left leg over top of head and hold.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as a Peacock
Sanskrit Verse:
ekapādamayūrāsanam---
kaṇṭhe pādaṃ prassaryaikamekapādaṃ mayūrake ॥47॥
Translation: One leg is placed over the neck and the other stretched out, forming ekapada-mayura.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
एकपादमयूरासनम ्---

Technique:
1. Sit and cross arms holding opposite big toes (right hand on top of left).
2. Keep left leg extended straight and pull right foot to left ear.
3. Gaze forward.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as the arrow to Shiva’s bow
Sanskrit Verse:
pādāṁguṣṭhau tu pāṇibhyāṁ
gṛhitvā śravaṇāvadhi ॥
dhanurākarṣaṇaṁ kṛtvā dhanurāsanamucyate ॥ 11 ॥
Translation: The big toes are caught with the hands and are pulled up to the ears. Thus one assumes the shape of a stretched bow. This is called dhanurasana
Sanskrit Verse.1:

धनुराकषर्णणंकृ त्वा धनुरासनमुच्यते॥ ११॥

Sanskrit Verse:
dviguṇaṁ patitaṁ pādam vāmam dakṣiṇatotthitam |
kṛtvā'nyonyatalasṭhaṁ tu vīrapaṭṭamathocyate ॥ 9 ॥

Technique:
1. Sit and lift left leg behind head.
2. Keep right leg extended straight.
3. Bring palms together in front of chest. 4. Gaze to third eye
Visualization: Visualize Swamiji, The SPH
Sanskrit Verse:
ekapādamatho kaṇṭhe utthāpyaikaṃ ca daṇḍavat ||
karau sampuṭitau kṛtvā ekapādaṃ taducyate || 64 ||
Translation: Having placed one leg over the neck, the other leg is raised up like a stick. Then hands are folded on the chest. This is called ekapada.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
एकपादमथो कण्ठेउत्थाप्यैकं च दण्डवत ् ||
करौ सम्पुǑटतौ कृ त्वा एकपादं तदुच्यते || ६४

Asana Images: https://i.pinimg.com/736x/d5/ad/74/d5ad7429a2710ab0632b041892e35f67.jpg

Technique:
1. Sit and keep left leg behind head.
2. Bring right heel to perineum.
3. Keep palms together in front of chest. 4. Gaze to third eye.
Visualization: Visualize Swamiji, The SPH
Sanskrit Verse:
besīne baṃne paga māthāupara lāvī ḍākanā pāchalyā bhāga para caḍhāvavā ne hātha joḍīne sthiti karavī te dvipādaśīrṣāsana kahevāya che। ā āsananā viśeṣa spaṣṭīkaraṇamāṭe pariśiṣṭamāṃ āpeluṃ ā āsananuṃ citra juo। keī yogīo ā āsanane pāśinīmudrā paṇa kahe che, ne āvī sthiti rākhī baṃne karatale pṛthvī para rākhīne śarīrane ūpāḍavāne vajelī mudrā kahe che। ā āsana kuṃḍalinīne prabodha karanāra tathā biṃdune jya karanāruṃ che।
vāmapādaśīrṣāsana tathā dakṣiṇapādaśīrṣāsana e ānā avāṃtarabheda che। ā āsano karatī velā baṃne hāthathī pagane paṃjo pakaḍa। - besīne ḍābo paga māthāupara caḍhāva te vāmapādaśīrṣāsana kahevāya che, ne besīne jamaṇe paga māthāupara caḍhāve te dakṣiṇapādaśīrṣāsana kahevāya che।
Translation: Sitting down, bring both legs behind your neck and palms together at the chest. This is Dvipadasirsasana. Some Yogis also call this asana Pasinimudra. In this posture, putting both your hands on the ground, and lifting up your body, is known as Vajrolimudrasana. This asana is used to awaken the Kundalini and Ajna Chakra, making your victorious over the Bindu. Sitting down and lifting the left leg on your head is Vamapada-sirsasana and lifting the right leg behind the head is Dakshinapada-sirsasana, two variations of this posture. Before doing these asanas, use both your hands and touch the base of the feet (stretch).
Sanskrit Verse.1:
बेसीनेबंनेपग माथाउपर लावी डाकना पाछल्या भाग पर चढाववा ने
हाथ जोडीनेिस्थǓत करवी तेद्ͪवपादशीषार्णसन कहेवाय छे । आ
आसनना ͪवशेष स्पष्टीकरणमाटेपǐरͧशष्टमांआपेलुंआ आसननुं
ͬचत्र जुओ। के ई योगीओ आ आसननेपाͧशनीमुद्रा पण कहेछे, ने
आवी िस्थǓत राखी बंनेकरतलेपृथ्वी पर राखीनेशरीरनेऊपाडवाने
वजेली मुद्रा कहेछे । आ आसन कुं डͧलनीनेप्रबोध करनार तथा ǒब ंदुने
ज्य करनारुं छे ।
वामपादशीषार्णसन तथा दͯक्षिणपादशीषार्णसन ए आना अवांतरभेद छे ।
आ आसनो करती वेला बंनेहाथथी पगनेपंजो पकड। - बेसीनेडाबो
पग माथाउपर चढाव तेवामपादशीषार्णसन कहेवाय छे, नेबेसीने
जमणेपग माथाउपर चढावेतेदͯक्षिणपादशीषार्णसन कहेवाय छे ।

Technique:
1. From kneeling position, place both hands on ground, fingers pointed backwards.
2. Bring elbows together at the navel.
3. Slowly lift entire body off the ground, keeping legs and upper body parallel to ground.
4. Bring right leg over top of head and hold.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as a Peacock
Sanskrit Verse:
ekapādamayūrāsanam---
kaṇṭhe pādaṃ prassaryaikamekapādaṃ mayūrake ॥47॥
Translation: One leg is placed over the neck and the other stretched out, forming ekapada-mayura.

Sanskrit Verse:
jānuprasāritabāhoḥśayanaṃ paryaṅkāsanam ।
kroñcoṣṭragajādivat upaveśanaṃ kroccādyāsanam [draṣṭavyam । | [sva. saṃ] āsyate upaviśyate atra hi bhāve pratyayo bodhyaḥ । iti viśeṣaḥ ।
iti dvayorāsanayorbhedaḥ।
vṛṣaṇaśabdohyaṇḍakośeti vyākhyātasya ।
sampuṭīkṛtya ūrdhvādhaḥ kṛtvā ।
sampuṭikām-ūdhrvādhobhāvam । nyaset kuryāt ।

प्रत्ययो बोÚयḥ । इǓत ͪवśएṣअḥ ।

Technique:
1. Sit and bring both feet together with arms below legs.
2. Raise feet over the head and bring palms together above the forehead. 3. Gaze to third eye.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as Sage Vashista
Sanskrit Verse:
doū pagathalī joḍī saṃpūṭa karai
hātha doū pagā bici āṇi talai kari bārai lyāī kūhaṇyā māhilī saṃdhi rāṣai
pāchai doū hāthā kī karī paga uṃcāī kākasī saṣā pari rāṣai paga lalāṭa moḍī jyu lagāvai draṣṭi nāsā agra āsaṇa kauguṇa pavana samāhita hoi
Translation: Sit in long position. Bring both feet together and insert the arms below the legs. Now raise both legs upwards as to bring the feet over the face. Fingers are interlocked and palms are placed over the forehead.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
दोऊ पगथली जोडी संपूट करै
हाथ दोऊ पगा ǒबͬच आͨण तलैकǐर बारै
ल्याई कू हण्या माǑहली संͬध राषै
पाछैदोऊ हाथा की करी पग उं चाई काकसी
सषा पǐर राषै
पग ललाट मोडी ज्युलगावैद्रिष्ट नासा अग्र
आसण कौगुण पवन समाǑहत होइ

Technique:
1. Sit and hold the feet, then lift them towards the head.
2. Hold the toes of the feet with fingers interlocked. 3. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as sacred Shiva Linga
Sanskrit Verse:
dou pāva sīsapari ānai phuni eka jugati aura tāhāṃ ṭhāneṃ |
dou pagake aṅguṣṭa joū tinpari mūṭhī kara kī dou || 233 ||
talā uparī dharai ju āna bhūpari rahai mūla ke pāni |
nāsā agra driṣṭi ṭhaharāvai sakala roga nāsako pāvai || 234 ||
Translation: Bring both feet over the head with the help of the hands. Hold the toes forming the fist of the hands. Anus should be well placed on the ground. Gaze a the tip of the nose.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
दोउ पाव सीसपǐर आनैफु Ǔन एक जुगǓत
और ताहांठानें |
दोउ पगके अङ्गुष्ट जोऊ ǓतÛपǐर मूठी कर
की दोउ || २३३ ||
तला उपरी धरैजुआन भूपǐर रहैमूल के
पाǓन |
नासा अग्र Ǒद्रिष्ट ठहरावैसकल रोग नासको पावै || २३४ ||

Technique:
1. Sit and lift both legs overtop of the shoulders.
2. Cross legs to keep them in place.
3. Place hands on the ground to the sides. 4. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as an owl sitting on a branch
Sanskrit Verse:
atha vakṣye kākarūpaskandhāsanamuttama
m ॥23.112॥
kalipāpāt pramucyeta vāyavīṃ vaśamānayet।
nijapādadvayaṃ baddhavā skandhadeśe ca sādhakaḥ ॥ 23.113॥
nityametat padadvandvaṃ bhūmau puṣṭikaradvayam ॥23.114॥
Translation:
Now I shall talk about the supreme kākarūpaskandhāsana;
The sādhaka should tie both his feet and place them on the shoulders (or) place both feet on the ground daily

Technique:
1. Sit and place one foot over the head.
2. Place second foot behind first leg.
3. Keep hands on the ground.4. Gaze to third eye.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as a bird in a forest
Sanskrit Verse: ekenapādena bhūmimavaṣṭabhya anyapādatalenauru avaṣṭabhaya tiṣṭhet āṣṭa iti punaḥ punaḥ kartavyaṃ ardhacaṃdraṃ bhavati ॥ 78 ॥
Translation: Placing one foot on the neck then keeping the second foot on that, remain holding with two hands. This is called Aranycatakasana.

CATAKASANA
Technique: 1. Sit and place one foot over the head.
2. Place second foot behind first leg.
3. Keep hands on the ground.4. Gaze to third eye.
Pranamaya: Pratyahara Kumbhaka
Bandha: Shambavi Mudra
Mudra: Mula Bandha
Visualization: Visualize yourself as a bird in a forest
Gaze: Third eye
Japa: Om Nithyananda
ParamaShivoham
Pramana Source: Kapalakurantaka’s
HathabhyasaPaddhati78
Sanskrit Verse (Pramana): ekenapādena bhūmimavaṣṭabhya anyapādatalenauru avaṣṭabhaya tiṣṭhet āṣṭa iti punaḥ punaḥ kartavyaṃ ardhacaṃdraṃ bhavati ॥ 78 ॥
Verse Translation: Placing one foot on the neck then keeping the second foot on that, remain holding with two hands. This is called Aranycatakasana.
Sanskrit Verse: एके नपादेन भूͧममवष्टभ्य अÛयपादतलेनौरु
अवष्टभय
Ǔतष्ठेत ्आष्ट इǓत पुनः पुनः कतर्णव्यंअधर्णचंद भवǓत ॥ ७८ ॥

Sanskrit Verse (Pramana): ekenapādena bhūmimavaṣṭabhya anyapādatalenauru avaṣṭabhaya tiṣṭhet āṣṭa iti punaḥ punaḥ kartavyaṃ ardhacaṃdraṃ bhavati ॥ 78 ॥

अवष्टभय
Ǔतष्ठेत ्आष्ट इǓत पुनः पुनः कतर्णव्यंअधर्णचंद भवǓत ॥ ७८ ॥
Asana Images: https://i.pinimg.com/736x/56/ea/78/56ea785035b2ab66e35c0c6c2a71df4b.jpg

Technique:
1. Sit and bring both feet together and lift them over the head.
2. Place right hand on left side of neck, keep elbow towards navel. 3. Extend left arm up straight.4. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize painting your reality and it manifesting into existence
Sanskrit Verse:
prathama pagathalī saṃpuṭa karai punaha jugati aisī vistare |
ḍāī kahūṇī māhilī saṅdhi tāpari dou eḍī bandha || 278 ||
phaṇā jugama ḍaratha kari rākhai bahuri jugati aisī vidhi dākhai |
bahuri pagathalī mahalī kora sīsa lagāvai karikai jora || 279 ||
eḍī punaha lalāta ju dākhai aṅgurī hatherī phaṇā ju rākhai |
dachina bhujakī hathelī joī galai lagāvai saṃpuṭa soī || 280 ||
āṅgurī sakala karai iha bhāua dachi pākhatī dharai su āī |
kahuṇī nābhi sudhi le āvai tāko udrahī āni lagāvai || 281 ||
patharī hovai peṭamai yā āsana so jāya |
gurumukha sādhana kījiye nāsā driṣṭi lagāya || 282 ||
Translation: Bring soles of feet together. With the help of left elbow raise both feet behind the head and hold them there. Take hold of the neck on left side by the right hand and bring its elbow to the navel. Direct the gaze at the nose.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
प्रथम पगथली संपुट करैपुनह जुगǓत ऐसी ͪवस्तरे |
डाई कहूणी माǑहली सङ्ͬध तापǐर दोउ एडी बÛध || २७८ ||
फणा जुगम डरथ कǐर राखैबहुǐर जुगǓत ऐसी ͪवͬध दाखै |
बहुǐर पगथली महली कोर सीस लगावैकǐरकैजोर || २७९ ||
एडी पुनह ललात जुदाखैअङ्गुरी हथेरी फणा जुराखै |
दǓछन भुजकी हथेली जोई गलैलगावैसंपुट सोई || २८० ||
आङ्गुरी सकल करैइह भाउअ दǓछ पाखती धरैसुआई |
कहुणी नाͧभ सुͬध लेआवैताको उद्रही आǓन लगावै || २८१ || पथरी होवैपेटमैया आसन सो जाय |
गुरुमुख साधन कीिजयेनासा Ǒद्रिष्ट लगाय || २८२ ||

Technique:
1. Sit and keep both legs behind the head.
2. Keep hands on ground. 3. Lift head up.
4. Gaze up to third eye.
Visualization: Visualize Swamiji, The SPH
Sanskrit Verse:
pādābhyāṃ veṣṭayetkaṇṭaṃ karayoḥ saṃsthitonmukham ।
phaṇīndraṃ sarvadoṣaghnaṃ vobhūyāt sukhadaṃ sadā ॥65॥
Translation: The neck is encircled with two legs and supporting (the body) with the hands, the face is turned upwards. This phanindra removes all the ills and bestows upon one wellness forever.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
पादाभ्यांवेष्टयेत्कण्टं करयोः
संिस्थतोÛमुखम ्।
फणीÛद्रं सवर्णदोषघ्नंवोभूयात ्सुखदं सदा ॥६५॥

फणीÛद्रं सवर्णदोषघ्नंवोभूयात ्सुखदं सदा ॥६५॥

Asana Number: 427

Technique: 1. Sit and keep both legs behind the head.
2. Keep hands on ground. 3. Lift head up.
4. Gaze up to third eye.

Visualization: Visualize Swamiji, The SPH

Sanskrit Verse (Pramana): pādābhyāṃ veṣṭayetkaṇṭaṃ karayoḥ saṃsthitonmukham ।
phaṇīndraṃ sarvadoṣaghnaṃ vobhūyāt sukhadaṃ sadā ॥65॥
Verse Translation: The neck is encircled with two legs and supporting (the body) with the hands, the face is turned upwards. This phanindra removes all the ills and bestows upon one wellness forever.
Sanskrit Verse: पादाभ्यांवेष्टयेत्कण्टं करयोः
संिस्थतोÛमुखम ्।

Visualization: Visualize yourself bound by a noose of integrity. A means to keep your emotions integrated, aligned to your purpose.
Sanskrit Verse:
kāṇṭḥpṛṣṭhe kṣipet pādau pāśavad dṛḍhabandhanam
sā eva pāśinī mudrā śaktiprabodhakāriṇī || 85 ||
Translation: Tie both the legs at the back of the neck strongly like a pasa (a noose- a loose loop secured in a rope or cord by means of a slipknot which slides along to tighten it if pulled). This is known as the Pasini-mudra. This mudra awakens the Kundalini sakt

Technique:
1. Sit with both feet crossed behind head.
2. Form a fist with the two hands and place one on top of other on the ground in front. 3. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as a fish
Sanskrit Verse:
baisī kari doū kaādhai rāṣai
āṭī karī doū hātha kī muṭhī karī ḍāī mūṭhī nīcai jīmaṇī ūpari rāṣī
je yahu āsana sādhau tau pūraba roga jāī
aora jegesvura eka bidhi aor karai
kāṭhā gohū pāva rāti bhijoya rāṣai
prathama je āpaṇī dhyāna aor dhāraṇā karatau hoī sau karai prabhāti karai va tā pīchai gohā kī tītī cābai tā ūpari ajyā ko dudha turate kau pībai ara yahu āsaṇa sādhai niti prati īsī jugati karai pachai sādhatā cyāri pahaira kau āsaṇa sādhai to mṛti jītabā samartha hoī
Translation: Sit on the floor. Take both feet over respective shoulders and then cross the feet behind the neck. Form fists of hands and place them one over the other on the ground in front.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
बैसी कǐर दोऊ कआधैराषै
आटी करी दोऊ हाथ की मुठी करी डाई मूठी नीचैजीमणी
ऊपǐर राषी
जेयहुआसन साधौ तौ पूरब रोग जाई
अओर जेगेस्वुर एक ǒबͬध अओर्करै
काठा गोहूपाव राǓत ͧभजोय राषै
प्रथम जेआपणी Úयान अओर्धारणा करतौ होई सौ करै
प्रभाǓत करैव ता पीछैगोहा की तीती चाबै
ता ऊपǐर अज्या को दुध तुरतेकौ पीबै
अर यहुआसण साधैǓनǓत प्रǓत ईसी जुगǓत कर पछैसाधता च्याǐर पहैर कौ आसण साधै
तो मृǓत जीतबा समथर्णहोई

Asana Images: https://i.pinimg.com/736x/59/5a/5e/595a5ea559d2d812e4c1566a07ec7ca3.jpg

Technique:
1. Sit and keep both legs raised up over the head.
2. Bring palms together in front of the chest.
3. Gaze forward
Visualization: Visualize Swamiji, The SPH
Sanskrit Verse:
besīne baṃne paga māthāupara lāvī ḍākanā pāchalyā bhāga para caḍhāvavā ne hātha joḍīne sthiti karavī te dvipādaśīrṣāsana kahevāya che। ā āsananā viśeṣa spaṣṭīkaraṇamāṭe pariśiṣṭamāṃ āpeluṃ ā āsananuṃ citra juo। keī yogīo ā āsanane pāśinīmudrā paṇa kahe che, ne āvī sthiti rākhī baṃne karatale pṛthvī para rākhīne śarīrane ūpāḍavāne vajelī mudrā kahe che। ā āsana kuṃḍalinīne prabodha karanāra tathā biṃdune jya karanāruṃ che।
vāmapādaśīrṣāsana tathā dakṣiṇapādaśīrṣāsana e ānā avāṃtarabheda che। ā āsano karatī velā baṃne hāthathī pagane paṃjo pakaḍa। - besīne ḍābo paga māthāupara caḍhāva te vāmapādaśīrṣāsana kahevāya che, ne besīne jamaṇe paga māthāupara caḍhāve te dakṣiṇapādaśīrṣāsana kahevāya che।
Translation: Sitting down, bring both legs behind your neck and palms together at the chest. This is Dvipadasirsasana. Some Yogis also call this asana Pasinimudra. In this posture, putting both your hands on the ground, and lifting up your body, is known as Vajrolimudrasana. This asana is used to awaken the Kundalini and Ajna Chakra, making your victorious over the Bindu. Sitting down and lifting the left leg on your head is Vamapada-sirsasana and lifting the right leg behind the head is Dakshinapada-sirsasana, two variations of this posture. Before doing these asanas, use both your hands and touch the base of the feet (stretch).
Sanskrit Verse.1:
बेसीनेबंनेपग माथाउपर लावी डाकना पाछल्या भाग पर चढाववा ने
हाथ जोडीनेिस्थǓत करवी तेद्ͪवपादशीषार्णसन कहेवाय छे । आ
आसनना ͪवशेष स्पष्टीकरणमाटेपǐरͧशष्टमांआपेलुंआ आसननुं
ͬचत्र जुओ। के ई योगीओ आ आसननेपाͧशनीमुद्रा पण कहेछे, ने
आवी िस्थǓत राखी बंनेकरतलेपृथ्वी पर राखीनेशरीरनेऊपाडवाने
वजेली मुद्रा कहेछे । आ आसन कुं डͧलनीनेप्रबोध करनार तथा ǒब ंदुने
ज्य करनारुं छे ।
वामपादशीषार्णसन तथा दͯक्षिणपादशीषार्णसन ए आना अवांतरभेद छे ।
आ आसनो करती वेला बंनेहाथथी पगनेपंजो पकड। - बेसीनेडाबो
पग माथाउपर चढाव तेवामपादशीषार्णसन कहेवाय छे, नेबेसीनेजमणे
पग माथाउपर चढावेतेदͯक्षिणपादशीषार्णसन कहेवाय छे ।

vāmapādaśīrṣāsana tathā dakṣiṇapādaśīrṣāsana e ānā avāṃtarabheda che। ā āsano karatī velā baṃne hāthathī pagane paṃjo pakaḍa। - besīne ḍābo paga māthāupara caḍhāva te vāmapādaśīrṣāsana kahevāya che, ne besīne jamaṇe paga māthāupara caḍhāve te dakṣiṇapādaśīrṣāsana kahevāya che।
Verse Translation: Sitting down, bring both legs behind your neck and palms together at the chest. This is Dvipadasirsasana. Some Yogis also call this asana Pasinimudra. In this posture, putting both your hands on the ground, and lifting up your body, is known as Vajrolimudrasana. This asana is used to awaken the Kundalini and Ajna Chakra, making your victorious over the Bindu. Sitting down and lifting the left leg on your head is Vamapada-sirsasana and lifting the right leg behind the head is Dakshinapada-sirsasana, two variations of this posture. Before doing these asanas, use both your hands and touch the base of the feet (stretch).
Sanskrit Verse: बेसीनेबंनेपग माथाउपर लावी डाकना पाछल्या भाग पर चढाववा ने
हाथ जोडीनेिस्थǓत करवी तेद्ͪवपादशीषार्णसन कहेवाय छे । आ
आसनना ͪवशेष स्पष्टीकरणमाटेपǐरͧशष्टमांआपेलुंआ आसननुं
ͬचत्र जुओ। के ई योगीओ आ आसननेपाͧशनीमुद्रा पण कहेछे, ने
आवी िस्थǓत राखी बंनेकरतलेपृथ्वी पर राखीनेशरीरनेऊपाडवाने
वजेली मुद्रा कहेछे । आ आसन कुं डͧलनीनेप्रबोध करनार तथा ǒब ंदुने
ज्य करनारुं छे ।
वामपादशीषार्णसन तथा दͯक्षिणपादशीषार्णसन ए आना अवांतरभेद छे ।
आ आसनो करती वेला बंनेहाथथी पगनेपंजो पकड। - बेसीनेडाबो
पग माथाउपर चढाव तेवामपादशीषार्णसन कहेवाय छे, नेबेसीनेजमणे
पग माथाउपर चढावेतेदͯक्षिणपादशीषार्णसन कहेवाय छे ।
Asana Images: https://i.pinimg.com/736x/61/d5/0c/61d50c2513cbc2de94c3a0751fdd1969.jpg

Technique:
1. Sit and join the soles of feet together.
2. Hold the toes with a fingerlock. 3. Raise the feet above the head.4. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize using the Shakti of Mahima, and feel the heaviness of body
Sanskrit Verse:
॥ atha bharatharé āsana ॥
āsana gopī canda kahyo jaise | yāhu ko kīje puni taise |
kora pagathalyā kī mahilī ||
siñā ānni mele doū milī ||
yā āsana ke kīye te mūlabandha lagi jāya |
jayata rāma sādhike rahe nāsādiñöi lagāya ||
Translation: This Asana is performed in a similar manner as Gopicanda Asana. Sit on the floor joining the soles and holding the toes making a fingerlock. Raise the feet over the head. Fix the gaze at the tip of the nose
Sanskrit Verse.1:
॥ अथ भरथर्é āसन ॥
āसन गोप ्ī चÛद कह्यो जैसे।
य ्āहुको क्īजेपुǓन तैसे ।
कोर पगथल्य ्ā क्ī मǑहल ्ī ॥
ͧसñā āिÛन मेलेदोū ͧमल ्ī ॥
य ्ā āसन के क्īयेतेम ्ūलबÛध लͬग
ज ्āय ।
जयत र्āम स ्āͬधके रहेन ्āस ्āǑदñöइ लग ्āय ॥

Technique:
1. Lay on back and raise the legs upwards.
2. Lock the fingers around ankles and bring legs near the head with soles of feet on ground.
3. Gaze to third eye.
Visualization: Visualize all of the Gods & Goddesses blessing you
Sanskrit Verse:
॥ atha deva āsana ॥
prathame sūdho sove soé , kare kāìkasé kara gaha doé |
eòayām ambara pagathélyāa dāñai , kari atika vitta tāsa pari rāñai ॥ 166 ॥
Translation: Lie on the floor, raise the legs upward. Forming a fingerlock of the hands put them around the ankles. Then bring the legs near the head and soles on the ground. Stay there keeping the head and hands in this manner. Gaze between eyebrows.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
॥ अथ देव आसन ।
प्रथमेसूधो सोवेसोई। करेकांकसी कर
गह दोई ।।
एडयांअंबर पगथील्यांदाधे। कǐर अǓतक ͪवत्त तास पǐर राषै॥ १६ ॥
