Technique:
1. Lay on back and raise the legs up.
2. Holding the feet from the side, keep them to side of ears and toes are visible.
3. Keep back of head on ground.
4. Gaze to nose and maintain silence.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as the source of energy, with nutritious vegetation sprouting from your being
Sanskrit Verse:
prathama sena sūdho hoya ṭhanai paga ucāya āgā nai ānai |
bahura pagathalī ko yo rākhai kora vāralī yā vidhi dākhai || 154 ||
vaṭī āṅgulyā lagatī āne kari gāḍhī jāḍāṅtari ṭhānai |
dou hātha paga bāhari lyāvai puni tākau aisai ṭhaharāvai || 155 ||
dachina karakau pahucau joī vācā kara sau pakarai soī |
mastaka bhūsoṃ legato rākhai nāsādriṣṭi vacana nahī bhākhai || 156 ||
joi kathothī lagai athavā anya ju vyādhi | yā āsana ke kyete tatakhina hoya samādhi || 157 ||
Translation: Lying on back raise the legs upward and keep the feet in such a way on the respective sides of the ears that fingers of the feet are visible. Grab the feet from the outside firmly by taking both the palms behind the back. Head (backside) should remain on the ground. Gaze should be on tip of nose and maintain silence.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
प्रथम सेन सूधो होय ठनैपग उचाय आगा नैआनै |
बहुर पगथली को यो राखैकोर वारली या ͪवͬध दाखै || १५४ ||
वटी आङ्गुल्या लगती आनेकǐर गाढी जाडाङ्तǐर ठानै |
दोउ हाथ पग बाहǐर ल्यावैपुǓन ताकौ ऐसैठहरावै
|| १५५ ||
दǓछन करकौ पहुचौ जोई वाचा कर सौ पकरैसोई |
मस्तक भूस ्ॐ लेगतो राखैनासाǑद्रिष्ट वचन नही
भाखै || १५६ ||
जोइ कथोथी लगैअथवा अÛय जुव्याͬध |
या आसन के Èयेतेततͨखन होय समाͬध || १५७ ||

Technique:
1. Lay on back and raise the legs upwards and cross legs behind head.
2. Place hands below buttocks and spread hands on ground. 3. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize an abundance of gold being showered on you
Sanskrit Verse:
masakāsana prathame sūdho saina hé kare vāmapāda kāndhapari dhare | tāpari dachina paga ko āne dou hasta aisé vidhi ohāne || tanaso lagivā nécā dhārai bhūpari sūdhā hasata pasāre |
nāsā agra driñoi ohaharāvai yāte roganāsa saba pāvai ||
Translation: First lie supine placing the left leg upon the (left) shoulder, bring the right leg upon the left leg. While touching the body spread both the hands down on ground. Fix the gaze upon the tip of the nose.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
मसक्āसन प्रथमेस ्ūधो सैन ह्é करे
व ्āमप ्āद क्āÛधपǐर धरे।
त ्āपǐर दͬचन पग को āनेदोउ हस्त ऐस ्é ͪवͬध ओह्āने॥
तनसो लͬगव ्ā न ्éच ्ā ध ्āरैभ ्ūपǐर स ्ūध ्ā हसत पस ्āरे।
न ्āस ्ā अग्र Ǒद्रñओइ ओहहर्āवैय ्āत रोगन ्āस सब प ्āवै॥

nāsā agra driñoi ohaharāvai yāte roganāsa saba pāvai ||
Verse Translation: First lie supine placing the left leg upon the (left) shoulder, bring the right leg upon the left leg. While touching the body spread both the hands down on ground. Fix the gaze upon the tip of the nose.
Sanskrit Verse: मसक्āसन प्रथमेस ्ūधो सैन ह्é करे
व ्āमप ्āद क्āÛधपǐर धरे।
त ्āपǐर दͬचन पग को āनेदोउ हस्त ऐस ्é ͪवͬध ओह्āने॥
तनसो लͬगव ्ā न ्éच ्ā ध ्āरैभ ्ūपǐर स ्ūध ्ā हसत पस ्āरे।
न ्āस ्ā अग्र Ǒद्रñओइ ओहहर्āवैय ्āत रोगन ्āस सब प ्āवै॥

Technique: 1. Lay down on back and hold big toes with respective hands.2. Gaze upwards.

Sanskrit Verse:
be hāthanī āṃgaḻīothī be paganāṃ āṃgaḻī pakaḍīne savuṃ te cakrāsana kahevāya che। ā āsananuṃ anya nāma vartalāsana paṇa che।
be hātha ne be paga bhūmipara rākhī udhī kamāna karavī tame paṇa keṭalāka cakrāsana kaheche
Translation: Lying down holding the toes of your legs with the fingers of your hands is called Cakrasana. Another name for this asana is called Vartulasana

करवी तमेपण के टलाक चक्रासन कहेछे ।

śavavadbhūmau tiṣṭet śavāsanaṃ bhavati ॥ 111 ॥
pādadvayaṃ vitanot tānāsanaṃ bhavati ॥ 112 ॥

Technique:
1. Lay down on back with elbows on ground and feet flat (knees raised up).
2. Raise the back upwards (lifting the middle portion of the body only).
Visualization: Visualize yourself as a mountain with three peaks
Sanskrit Verse:
uttānaśayanaṃ pādatalābhyāṃ bhūmiṃ dhṛtvā kūrparo avanau nidhāya pṛṣṭapradeśamūrdhvamunnama
yet trikūṭaṃ bhavati ॥9॥
Translation: Lying supine keeping both the elbows on the ground and holding the ground with the feet also raise the (middle) back portion of the body (upwards). This is called Trikuta. (elevating the middle portion only of the body.)
Sanskrit Verse.1:
उत्तानशयनंपादतलाभ्यांभूͧम ंधृत्वा कू पर्णरो

पृष्टप्रदेशमूÚवर्णमुÛनमयेत ्ǒत्रकू टं भवǓत ॥९॥

Sanskrit Verse:
saptacakrakṣālanāya vṛkṣāsanaviśeṣakān |
jananendriyadārḍhyāya koṇabhedān samabhyaset || 20
Translation: For cleaning the seven chakras, Vrksasana is considered very special. And for strengthening the reproductive organs, different variations of konasana must be practiced. (Konasana includes: Trikonasana, parsva konasana, upavista konasana, supta konasana, viparitya konasana and urdhva konasana.)

jananendriyadārḍhyāya koṇabhedān samabhyaset || 20
Verse Translation: For cleaning the seven chakras, Vrksasana is considered very special. And for strengthening the reproductive organs, different variations of konasana must be practiced. (Konasana includes: Trikonasana, parsva konasana, upavista konasana, supta konasana, viparitya konasana and urdhva konasana.)

akukkutameva ca |

Technique:
1. Lie on back and place feet flat on mat.
2. Bring arms over head and place hands flat
on mat with fingers pointing towards feet.
3. Lift the entire body up off the ground and walk hands towards feet.
4. Hold ankles of feet with the hands.

Sanskrit Verse: āsaṇa kauguṇa pāna apāni kī gāṭhi ṣuṭai jalandharabandha lāgai

Sanskrit Verse: atha vicitrakaraṇīnāmāsanam śayitapaścamatānasthe hastau tatra prsārayet || padau dandasamau krtva vicitrakarani bhavet ||69||
Translation: Stretch both the legs on the ground. Hold the big toes by the respective hands. Extend the hands and straighten the legs. This asana is called vicitra karani.

पादौ दण्डसमौ कृ त्वा ͪवͬचत्रकरणी भवेत || ६९ ||

Asana Images:

Technique:
1. Lay down on back with elbows on the navel.
2. Bring one hand up and touch the nose with the thumb, other hand extended towards hip.
3. Squeeze stomach and switch sides 4. Repeat again and again.
Visualization: *Visualize yourself as a hatchet being thrown
Sanskrit Verse:
pādatale bhūmaunidhāya jānuni urasi nidhāya viparīta hastābhyāṃ
urusahita jaṃghe nibadhya tiṣṭhet paśāsanaṃ bhavati ॥61॥
pārṣṇibhyāṃ bhūmimavaṣṭbhya hastadvayena gulphau dhṛtvā
tiṣṭet kādaṃbaṃ bhavati ॥62॥
Translation: Lying supine place your both the elbows against the navel. Then extending one hand hold the nose with the thumb (of that hand) and finding that side also hold the hip. This is known as Parasvasana.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
पादतलेभूमौǓनधाय जानुǓन उरͧस Ǔनधाय
ͪवपरीत हस्ताभ्यां
उरुसǑहत जंघेǓनबÚय Ǔतष्ठेत ्पशासनं
भवǓत ॥६१॥
पािष्णर्णभ्यांभूͧममवष्ट्भ्य हस्तद्वयेन गुल्फौ
धृत्वा
Ǔतष्टेत ्कादंबंभवǓत ॥६२॥

pārṣṇibhyāṃ bhūmimavaṣṭbhya hastadvayena gulphau dhṛtvā
tiṣṭet kādaṃbaṃ bhavati ॥62॥
Verse Translation: Lying supine place your both the elbows against the navel. Then extending one hand hold the nose with the thumb (of that hand) and finding that side also hold the hip. This is known as Parasvasana.
Sanskrit Verse: पादतलेभूमौǓनधाय जानुǓन उरͧस Ǔनधाय
ͪवपरीत हस्ताभ्यां
उरुसǑहत जंघेǓनबÚय Ǔतष्ठेत ्पशासनं
भवǓत ॥६१॥
पािष्णर्णभ्यांभूͧममवष्ट्भ्य हस्तद्वयेन गुल्फौ
धृत्वा
Ǔतष्टेत ्कादंबंभवǓत ॥६२॥

Technique:
1. Lay down on right side of body and stretch legs out.
2. Bend right elbow and support the head with the right palm.
3. Extend the left hand and rest it on side of body.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as Dakshinamurti
Sanskrit Verse:
Śayyarju dakṣiṇāṅgena, mastake'dho nidhāyasaḥ ।
dakṣaṃ hastaṃ ca vāmaṃtu, jaṅghapṛṣṭhe tato japet ॥25॥
Śaṃprayāti rujāśoko duḥsvapnaṃ vīryapātanam ।
Pacanaśaktir agnistu vardhate dakṣiṇāsanaiḥ ॥ 26 ॥
Translation: Lay down on the right side of the body and stretch the legs. Bend the right elbow and support the head with right palm. Extend the left arm and rest the left hand on the left side of the body
Sanskrit Verse.1:
शय्यजुर्णदͯक्षिणांगेन, मस्तके ऽधोǓनधायस : ।
दक्षिंहस्तंच वामंतु, जंघपृष्ठेततो जपेत ्॥
२५॥
शंप्रयाǓतरुजाशोको, दु:स्वप्नंवीयर्णपातनम ्।
पचनशिÈतरिग्नस्तु, वधर्णतेदͯक्षिणासनै: ॥ २६

Technique:
1. Lay on stomach and catch hold of both feet behind you.
2. Hold tops of the feet and press them towards the ground outside of the hips.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as a frog
Sanskrit Verse:
bakaṁ bhekāsanaṁ caiva makaraṁ matsyanāmakam |
matsyendram dvividhaṁ cātra kundalībodhakāraṇam |
Translation: Bakāsana, Bhekāsana, Makarāsana and Matsyāsana. The two types Matsyendrāsana will remove the blockage caused by the Kundalini.

कु ण्डलीबोधकारणम ्॥

Technique:
1. Laying down on the stomach, take a deep inhalation and expand the chest.
2. Lift one arm and hold the respective foot with the thumb, middle, and ring finger.
3. Extend opposite hand away on the grouud then alternate on the other side.
Sanskrit Verse:
niṣaṇṇāṅgastu caraṇaṃ prasārya talasañcaram
udvāhitamuraḥ kṛtvā śakaṭāsyaṃ prayojayet ॥107॥
Translation: Beginning with body at rest, advancing with a talasanchara foot and making the breast udvahita.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
॥ Ǔनषण्णाङ्गस्तुचरणंप्रसायर्ण
तलसञ्चरम ्
उद्वाǑहतमुरः कृ त्वा शकटास्यंप्रयोजयेत ् ॥107॥

Technique:
1. Lay down on stomach with elbows on ground and chin resting on palm of hands.
2. Keep knees bent and legs vertical.
3. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize Swamiji, The SPH
Sanskrit Verse:
kūrparābhyāmavanimavaṣṭabhya hastatalābhyaṃ
hanuṃ avaṣṭabhya uttiṣṭhet śūlāsanaṃ bhavati ॥42॥
Translation: Holding the ground with two elbows and catching the cheeks with two hands (i.e. palms), get up (extend the upper portion). This is called Sulasana
Sanskrit Verse.1:
कू पर्णराभ्यामवǓनमवष्टभ्य हस्ततलाभ्यं
हनुंअवष्टभ्य उͪत्तष्ठेत ्शूलासनंभवǓत ॥४२॥

3. Gaze to nose.

Verse Translation: Holding the ground with two elbows and catching the cheeks with two hands (i.e. palms), get up (extend the upper portion). This is called Sulasana

Sanskrit Verse: ūṃdhā sūīne baṃne hātha māthānī baṃne bhaṇī thaī āgaḻa jāya tema lāṃbā karavā, ne tenā paṃjā uparanā bhāgamāṃ aḍelā ne nīce ṭā rākhavā, tathā paga lāṃbā karī aḍāḍelā rākhavā te makarāsana kahevāya che।
Translation: Laying down on the stomach, stretch the arms out front. Bend the elbows and place the top part of the hands touching (of the head). This is Makarasana.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
ऊं धा सूईनेबंनेहाथ माथानी बंनेभणी थई
आगळ जाय तेम लांबा करवा, नेतेना पंजा
उपरना भागमांअडेला नेनीचे
टा राखवा, तथा पग लांबा करी अडाडेला
राखवा तेमकरासन कहेवाय छे ।

Technique:
1. Place hands next to chest, toes on ground, and lower body just above mat.
2. Maintain position hovering above the mat.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as sturdy wooden stick or staff
Sanskrit Verse:
viparītaṃ maṇḍalaṃ ca dvidhaiva viditaṃ hi naḥ ।
daṇḍāsanaṃ dvidhā proktaṃ viparītopaveśane ॥
sarvāṅgaśīrṣabhāgāstu ṣaṭṣaṣṭiḥ prathitāstu te ।
Translation: Then there are two types of inverted mandalas (arrangements) – Sirsasana and Sarvangasana. Dandasana is also of two types inverted (Viparita Dandasana) and seated (Dandasana). It has been proclaimed that there are sixty six variations of Sarvangasan and Sirsasana.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
ͪवपरीतंमण्डलंच द्ͪवधैव ͪवǑदतंǑह नः ।
दण्डासनंद्ͪवधा प्रोÈतंͪवपरीतोपवेशने॥
सवार्णङ्गशीषर्णभागास्तुषट्षिष्टः प्रͬथतास्तुत सवार्णङ्गशीषर्णभागास्तुषट्षिष्टः प्रͬथतास्तुते
।

Sanskrit Verse (Pramana): viparītaṃ maṇḍalaṃ ca dvidhaiva viditaṃ hi naḥ ।
daṇḍāsanaṃ dvidhā proktaṃ viparītopaveśane ॥
sarvāṅgaśīrṣabhāgāstu ṣaṭṣaṣṭiḥ prathitāstu te ।
Verse Translation: Then there are two types of inverted mandalas (arrangements) – Sirsasana and Sarvangasana. Dandasana is also of two types inverted (Viparita Dandasana) and seated (Dandasana). It has been proclaimed that there are sixty six variations of Sarvangasan and Sirsasana.
Sanskrit Verse: ͪवपरीतंमण्डलंच द्ͪवधैव ͪवǑदतंǑह नः ।
दण्डासनंद्ͪवधा प्रोÈतंͪवपरीतोपवेशने॥
सवार्णङ्गशीषर्णभागास्तुषट्षिष्टः प्रͬथतास्तुत सवार्णङ्गशीषर्णभागास्तुषट्षिष्टः प्रͬथतास्तुते
।
Asana Images: https://i.pinimg.com/736x/3b/80/89/3b80891d49fff7b6db2472eb4dc0f689.jpg

Technique: 1. From kneeling position, place the left foot on the right and buttocks on heels. 2. Place hands on ears and bring forehead down on mat, making contact with the knees. 3. Forcefully pull the apana vayu upwards.
Visualization: Visualize yourself having no karma
Sanskrit Verse:
atha nirañjanakarmāsanam ||
bālako garbhaśayyāyām tișthet sankucito yathā|
tathā garbhāsane yogi nirañjanavidhim bhajet ||124|||
dattvā dakṣānghrau vāmānghrim pārņņibhyām rundhayet sphijau |
apānam ārdhvam ca kuryād vāras vāram tato balāt ||125||
jānvante mastakam datvā nābhim prsthe vikarşayet |
pāņibhyām cchādayet karņau netre tisthed atikramaiḥ ||126|||
tadā nābheḥ sakāśāt tu śabdo 'syottișthate sa 'ņuḥ||
nirañjanam jyotir agre sūkṣmaṇ cāsya parisphuret ||127|||
ruddho 'ntar udare vāyur jațharāntar bhraman muhuḥ|| ūrdhvam gatvā mastakānte muhur yāty udarāntare ||128|||
śaśvad vidhim imam kṛtvā nirañjanavicintanam|
labhate brahma yad guptam prakațam sādhakottamaḥ||129|||
naśyanti kāmabhiḥ kopā abhyāsenāsya yoginaḥ||
moho malinatā naśyec chivajīvaikyatā bhavet || 130|| iti nirañjanakarmāsanam ||
Translation: Now, the āsana in which spotless action [is performed.] Just as a child curls up and remains in a foetal position, so the yogin should practice nirañjanakarma in the foetal pose. Having put the left foot on the right and having fixed the buttocks on the heels, he should move apānavāyu forcefully upwards again and again. Having put his head on his knees,he should draw the navel into the back [of the body, cover the ears and eyes with the hands and remain (there) spontaneously. Then, a faint sound rises up from his navel and subsequently, a pure and subtle light shines in front of him. The breath, having stopped in the stomach, moves in the abdomen. Having gone up again into the head,it goes [down] again into the stomach.

दत्त्वा दक्षिाÛघ्रिौ वामािÛघ्रिम ्पार्ņņइभ्याम ्रुÛधयेत ्िस्फजौ |

जाÛवÛतेमस्तकम ्दत्वा नाͧभम ्प्र्स्थेͪवकर्şअयेत ् |
पाņइभ्याम ्च्छादयेत ्कर्ņऔ नेत्रेǓतस्थेद् अǓतक्रमैः ||१२६|||

रुद्धो ऽÛतर्उदरेवायुर्जțहराÛतर्भ्रमन ्मुहुः|| ऊÚवर्णम ्गत्वा मस्तकाÛतेमुहुर्यात्य ्उदराÛतरे ||१२८|||

Technique:
1. From kneeling position, place both hands on ground, fingers pointed backwards.
2. Bring elbows together at the navel.
3. Slowly lift entire body off the ground, keeping legs and upper body parallel to ground.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as a Peacock
Sanskrit Verse:
mayūraṃ daṇḍavatkūryānmāyūraṃ daṇḍanāmakam ॥
kuryānmāyūraṃ pārśvābhyāṃ māyūrapārśvanāmakam ॥44॥
Translation: When mayura is practiced like a (horizontal) stick, it is called danda-mayura. This same when practiced on both the sides, is parsva-mayura. 44
Sanskrit Verse.1:
मयूरं दण्डवत्कू यार्णÛमायूरं दण्डनामकम ्॥
कु यार्णÛमायूरं पाश्वार्णभ्यांमायूरपाश्वर्णनामकम ्॥ ४४॥

Technique:
1. From kneeling position, place left hand on ground, fingers pointed backwards.
2. Bring elbow to the navel.
3. Slowly lift entire body off the ground, keeping legs and upper body parallel to ground.

Sanskrit Verse: mayūrāsanavatsaṃsṭhāpya ekena hastena ekasya hastasya maṇibandhaṃ dhārayet paṃgumayūraṃ bhavati ॥40॥
Translation: Assuming the position of Mayurasana hold by one hand the wrist of another hand. This is called Pangumayura.

Technique:
1. Sit and place the sole of left foot on the ground to right side of groin.
2. Place right foot backwards outside of right hip.
3. Engage all three bandhas.3. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize the Hindu God of Knowledge, Goddess Saraswathi
Sanskrit Verse:
athānyadāsanaṃ kṛtvā sarvavyādhinivāraṇam।
yogābhyāsī bhavetkṣipraṃ jñānāsanaprasādataḥ॥23.94॥
dakṣapādorumūle ca vāmapādatalaṃtathā।
dakṣapādatalaṃ dakṣapārśve saṃyojya dhārayet॥23.95॥
Translation:
Thus by doing other asanas all diseases are annulled.
The practitioner of Yoga quickly becomes (siddha) as a result of jnānāsana.
Place the sole of the left foot on the right side at the groin.
Then place the sole of the right foot behind the back and hold it O Lord! This is called the jñānāsana which gives the light of knowledge.
One who does this regularly his joints become relaxed.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
अथाÛयदासनंकृ त्वा सवर्णव्याͬधǓनवारणम ्।
योगाभ्यासी भवेित्क्षिप्रंज्ञानासनप्रसादतः॥
२३.९४॥
दक्षिपादोरुमूलेच वामपादतलंतथा।
दक्षिपादतलंदक्षिपाश्वर्श्वेसंयोज्य धारयेत ्॥२३.९५॥

Technique:
1. Sit and keep right heel outside of right hip.
2. Take left foot and turn it upwards then place it in left armpit.
3. Gaze to third eye.
Visualization: Visualize yourself having no karma
Sanskrit Verse:
atha jaṭharāgni-sandīpanaṃ-gulmaplī
ha-śúlahara-kubjikāsanam
kiñcittiryak sakthimāsthāpya jānumūrdhvaṃ dhṛtvā saṃ parāvartanena
kakṣāmūle pādamādāya tiṣthed-etat pīṭhaṃ kubjikaṃ vahnikārī || 35 ||
Translation: Fold one knee and keep the foot by the side of the hip. Then turn the other foot upwards and place it in the respective armpit and remain steady.

Technique:
1. Sit and keep right heel outside of right hip.
2. Place left foot on top of right thigh.
3. Bring left hand around back and catch hold of left foot.
4. Bring right hand to outside of left thigh and twist.5. Gaze to third eye.
Visualization: Visualize Lord Kartikeya, the ruler of planet Mars
Sanskrit Verse: uttānakūrmapithaí ca saiṁhas gārudameva ca | vātāyanaṁ gomukhaṁ ca bhāradvājaṁ trivikramam ||

Technique:
1. Sit on knees and keep right heel behind.
2. Place left heel on navel, toes towards chest.
3. Both hands on respective knees.
4. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Embody the state and space of Bravery
Sanskrit Verse:
ekam pādamathaikasminvinyasedūrusa
msthitam | itarasimastathā paścādvīrāsanamitīritam ||
Translation: One leg (the right foot) to be placed on the other (left) thigh, and the other foot to be turned backwards: This is called the Virasana (Hero-posture).
Sanskrit Verse.1:
एकं पादमथैकिस्मिÛवÛयसेदूरुसंिस्थतम ्।
इतरͧसमस्तथा पश्चाद्वीरासनͧमतीǐरतम ् ||१८||

Technique:
1. Place perineum on right heel.
2. Place left heel on navel, toes towards chest.
3. Interlock the fingers and stretch both hands upwards.
4. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as the head of a wolf pack or another beast of prey
Sanskrit Verse:
muladvāra ṭika baisika dharaī vāmapada guda aundhau karaī |
eḍi agra gudātari dharai urdhva ciṭī aṅguṣṭatari karai || 95 ||
gulapha vārilau kūlai ānai punaha māhilau bhūpari ṭhanai |
bahuri carana dāhinau joī hṛdai āni lagāvai soī || 96 ||
phaṇā pṛṣṭa ko hṛdai levai eḍī nābhimadhi puni devai |
goḍā jaṅgha bhūmi pari lāvai aṅtara hātha eka ṭhaharāvai || 97 ||
doū karakī kāṅkasī rākhai sikhā ju soya |
nāsādriṣṭi lagāiye bhairu āsana hoya || 98 ||
pahara eka āsana sadhi aāvai kuṅḍalanī vyākula hoya dhāvai |
vadhata kale jo vadai na soī kaṃvala hridā kau sudho hoī || 99 ||
tilī phīhau golau jāī āṃva hara sahiḍa kī ju nasāī |
nāḍī sabai sudha hoī rahai gatā doṣa ju bhairu dahai || 100 ||
Translation: Place left foot on ground and place the anus on left heel. Put left knee also on ground. Take the other heel at the navel and the toes at the chest. Keep the body upright and by interlocking the fingers, stretch both hands upwards and gaze at the tip of the nose.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
ुलद्वार Ǒटक बैͧसक धरई वामपद गुद औÛधौ करई |
एͫड अग्र गुदातǐर धरैउÚवर्णͬचटी अङ्गुष्टतǐर करै || ९५ ||
गुलफ वाǐरलौ कू लैआनैपुनह माǑहलौ भूपǐर ठनै |
बहुǐर चरन दाǑहनौ जोई हृदैआǓन लगावैसोई || ९६ ||
फणा पृष्ट को हृदैलेवैएडी नाͧभमͬध पुǓन देवै |
गोडा जङ्घ भूͧम पǐर लावैअङ्तर हाथ एक ठहरावै || ९७ ||
दोऊ करकी काङ्कसी राखैͧसखा जुसोय |
नासाǑद्रिष्ट लगाइयेभैरु आसन होय || ९८ ||
पहर एक आसन सͬध अआवैकु ङ्डलनी व्याकु ल होय धावै |
वधत कलेजो वदैन सोई कं वल Ǒह्रदा कौ सुधो होई || ९९ ||
Ǔतली फीहौ गोलौ जाई आंव हर सǑहड की जुनसाई |
नाडी सबैसुध होई रहैगता दोष जुभैरु दहै || १०० ||
Unnamed: 19:
Asana Number: 467
Asana Name: BHAIRU ASANA 2
Technique: 1. Place perineum on right heel.
2. Place left heel on navel, toes towards chest.
3. Interlock the fingers and stretch both hands upwards.
4. Gaze to nose.
Pranamaya: Sama Kumbhaka
Bandha: Paruśu Mudra
Mudra: Mula Bandha
Visualization: Visualize yourself as the head of a wolf pack or another beast of prey
Gaze: To nose
Japa: Om Nithyananda
ParamaShivoham
Pramana Source: JogaPradipika95-98
Sanskrit Verse (Pramana): muladvāra ṭika baisika dharaī vāmapada guda aundhau karaī |
eḍi agra gudātari dharai urdhva ciṭī aṅguṣṭatari karai || 95 ||
gulapha vārilau kūlai ānai punaha māhilau bhūpari ṭhanai |
bahuri carana dāhinau joī hṛdai āni lagāvai soī || 96 ||
phaṇā pṛṣṭa ko hṛdai levai eḍī nābhimadhi puni devai |
goḍā jaṅgha bhūmi pari lāvai aṅtara hātha eka ṭhaharāvai || 97 ||
doū karakī kāṅkasī rākhai sikhā ju soya |
nāsādriṣṭi lagāiye bhairu āsana hoya || 98 ||
pahara eka āsana sadhi aāvai kuṅḍalanī vyākula hoya dhāvai |
vadhata kale jo vadai na soī kaṃvala hridā kau sudho hoī || 99 ||
tilī phīhau golau jāī āṃva hara sahiḍa kī ju nasāī |
nāḍī sabai sudha hoī rahai gatā doṣa ju bhairu dahai || 100 ||
Verse Translation: Place left foot on ground and place the anus on left heel. Put left knee also on ground. Take the other heel at the navel and the toes at the chest. Keep the body upright and by interlocking the fingers, stretch both hands upwards and gaze at the tip of the nose.
Sanskrit Verse: ुलद्वार Ǒटक बैͧसक धरई वामपद गुद औÛधौ करई |
एͫड अग्र गुदातǐर धरैउÚवर्णͬचटी अङ्गुष्टतǐर करै || ९५ ||
गुलफ वाǐरलौ कू लैआनैपुनह माǑहलौ भूपǐर ठनै |
बहुǐर चरन दाǑहनौ जोई हृदैआǓन लगावैसोई || ९६ ||
फणा पृष्ट को हृदैलेवैएडी नाͧभमͬध पुǓन देवै |
गोडा जङ्घ भूͧम पǐर लावैअङ्तर हाथ एक ठहरावै || ९७ ||
दोऊ करकी काङ्कसी राखैͧसखा जुसोय |
नासाǑद्रिष्ट लगाइयेभैरु आसन होय || ९८ ||
पहर एक आसन सͬध अआवैकु ङ्डलनी व्याकु ल होय धावै |
वधत कलेजो वदैन सोई कं वल Ǒह्रदा कौ सुधो होई || ९९ ||
Ǔतली फीहौ गोलौ जाई आंव हर सǑहड की जुनसाई |
नाडी सबैसुध होई रहैगता दोष जुभैरु दहै || १०० ||

Technique:
1. Sit with left foot on top of right thigh.
2. Place right foot over top and to the side of right knee. 3. Twist body towards raised knee.
4. Wrap arm around raised knee and clasp hands behind back.
5. Gaze to third eye
Visualization: Visualize the great Sage and Yogi, Matsyendranath; founder of Hatha Yoga
Sanskrit Verse:
matsyendrapītham jatharapradiptam |
pracandarugmandalakhandanāstr
am ||
abhyāsatah kundaliniprabodham |
dandasthiratvam ca dadāti pumsām ||
pārśvābhyām dhriyate yastu pārsvamatsyendramuttamam |
karena bandhayet tattu baddhamatsyendrāsanam || 60 ||
Translation: Matsyendra-pītha enhances the gastric fire and works like a weapon to destroy hosts of severe diseases. Moreover, it helps arousal of kundalini and offers stability to the spine. When held by the sides, it forms pārsva-matsyendra, which is excellent. When tied with the hand, it makes baddha-matsyendra.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
मत्स्येÛद्रपीठं जठरप्रदीप्तं प्रचण्डरुग्मण्डलखण्डनास्त्रम ्॥
अभ्यासतः कु ण्डͧलनीप्रबोधंदण्डिस्थरत्वंच
ददाǓत पुंसाम ्॥ 58॥
पाश्वभ्यांͬध्रियतेयस्तुपाश्र्वमत्स्येÛद्रमुत्तमम ् | 59 | करेण बÛधयेत ्तत्तुबद्धमत्स्येÛद्रासनम ्

Asana Images: https://i.pinimg.com/736x/2a/38/c9/2a38c9c4022b0bc52d1fc0b08a0d96ba.jpg

Technique:
1. Sit and place the sole of right foot on the ground to left side of groin.
2. Place left foot backwards outside of left hip.
3. Engage all three bandhas.
3. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize the Hindu God of Knowledge, Goddess Saraswathi
Sanskrit Verse:
athānyadāsanaṃ kṛtvā sarvavyādhinivāraṇam।
yogābhyāsī bhavetkṣipraṃ jñānāsanaprasādataḥ॥23.94॥
dakṣapādorumūle ca vāmapādatalaṃtathā।
dakṣapādatalaṃ dakṣapārśve saṃyojya dhārayet॥23.95॥
Translation:
Thus by doing other asanas all diseases are annulled.
The practitioner of Yoga quickly becomes (siddha) as a result of jnānāsana.
Place the sole of the left foot on the right side at the groin.
Then place the sole of the right foot behind the back and hold it.
O Lord! This is called the jñānāsana which gives the light of knowledge.
One who does this regularly his joints become relaxed.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
अथाÛयदासनंकृ त्वा सवर्णव्याͬधǓनवारणम ्।
योगाभ्यासी भवेित्क्षिप्रंज्ञानासनप्रसादतः॥
२३.९४॥
दक्षिपादोरुमूलेच वामपादतलंतथा।
दक्षिपादतलंदक्षिपाश्वर्श्वेसंयोज्य धारयेत ्॥२३.९५॥

Technique:
1. Sit and keep left heel outside of left hip.
2. Take right foot and turn it upwards then place it in right armpit.
3. Gaze to third eye.
Visualization: Visualize yourself having no karma
Sanskrit Verse:
atha jaṭharāgni-sandīpanaṃ-gulmaplī
ha-śúlahara-kubjikāsanam
kiñcittiryak sakthimāsthāpya jānumūrdhvaṃ dhṛtvā saṃ parāvartanena
kakṣāmūle pādamādāya tiṣthed-etat pīṭhaṃ kubjikaṃ vahnikārī || 35 ||
Translation: Fold one knee and keep the foot by the side of the hip. Then turn the other foot upwards and place it in the respective armpit and remain steady.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
अथ जठरािग्न-सÛदीपनं-गुल्मप्लीह-
श ्úलहर-कु िÞजकासनम ्
ͩकिञ्चͪत्तयर्णक्सिÈथमास्थाप्य जानुमूÚवर्ध्वं
धृत्वा संपरावतर्णनेन
कक्षिामूलेपादमादाय Ǔतष्थेद्-एतत ्पीठं
कु िÞजकं विह्नकारी || ३५ ||

ͩकिञ्चͪत्तयर्णक्सिÈथमास्थाप्य जानुमूÚवर्ध्वं
धृत्वा संपरावतर्णनेन
कक्षिामूलेपादमादाय Ǔतष्थेद्-एतत ्पीठं
कु िÞजकं विह्नकारी || ३५ ||
Asana Images: https://i.pinimg.com/736x/38/53/e3/3853e340eb64a97b9d1e08310986f6ef.jpg

Technique:
1. Sit and keep left heel outside of left hip.
2. Place right foot on top of left thigh.
3. Bring right hand around back and catch hold of right foot.
4. Bring left hand to outside of right thigh and twist.
5. Gaze to third eye.
Visualization: Visualize Lord Kartikeya, the ruler of planet Mars
Sanskrit Verse: uttānakūrmapithaí ca saiṁhas gārudameva ca | vātāyanaṁ gomukhaṁ ca bhāradvājaṁ trivikramam ||
Translation: (Examples of best asanas are) Uttāna Kūrmasana, Simhāsana, Garudāsana, Vātāyanāsa, Gomukhāsana, Bhāradvājāsana and Trivikramāsana.

वातायनंगोमुखंच भारद्वाजंǒत्रͪवक्रमम ्॥

Technique:
1. Sit on knees and keep left heel behind.
2. Place left heel on navel, toes towards chest.
3. Hands on respective knees.
4. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Embody the state and space of Bravery
Sanskrit Verse:
ekam pādamathaikasminvinyasedūru
samsthitam | itarasimastathā paścādvīrāsanamitīritam ||
Translation: One leg (the right foot) to be placed on the other (left) thigh, and the other foot to be turned backwards: This is called the Virasana (Hero-posture)
Sanskrit Verse.1:
एकं पादमथैकिस्मिÛवÛयसेदूरुसंिस्थतम ्।
इतरͧसमस्तथा पश्चाद्वीरासनͧमतीǐरतम ् ||१८||

Asana Images: https://i.pinimg.com/736x/5c/e0/81/5ce081cf3eed02034e3b281f2323d526.jpg

Technique:
1. Sit on knees and place perineum on right heel.
2. Place left heel on navel, toes towards chest.
3. Interlock the fingers and stretch both hands upwards.
4. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as the head of a wolf pack or another beast of prey
Sanskrit Verse:
muladvāra ṭika baisika dharaī vāmapada guda aundhau karaī |
eḍi agra gudātari dharai urdhva ciṭī aṅguṣṭatari karai || 95 ||
gulapha vārilau kūlai ānai punaha māhilau bhūpari ṭhanai |
bahuri carana dāhinau joī hṛdai āni lagāvai soī || 96 ||
phaṇā pṛṣṭa ko hṛdai levai eḍī nābhimadhi puni devai |
goḍā jaṅgha bhūmi pari lāvai aṅtara hātha eka ṭhaharāvai || 97 ||
doū karakī kāṅkasī rākhai sikhā ju soya |
nāsādriṣṭi lagāiye bhairu āsana hoya || 98 ||
pahara eka āsana sadhi aāvai kuṅḍalanī vyākula hoya dhāvai |
vadhata kale jo vadai na soī kaṃvala hridā kau sudho hoī || 99 ||
tilī phīhau golau jāī āṃva hara sahiḍa kī ju nasāī |
nāḍī sabai sudha hoī rahai gatā doṣa ju bhairu dahai || 100 ||
Translation: Place left foot on ground and place the anus on left heel. Put left knee also on ground. Take the other heel at the navel and the toes at the chest. Keep the body upright and by interlocking the fingers, stretch both hands upwards and gaze at the tip of the nose.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
मुलद्वार Ǒटक बैͧसक धरई वामपद गुद औÛधौ करई |
एͫड अग्र गुदातǐर धरैउÚवर्णͬचटी अङ्गुष्टतǐर करै || ९५ ||
गुलफ वाǐरलौ कू लैआनैपुनह माǑहलौ भूपǐर ठनै |
बहुǐर चरन दाǑहनौ जोई हृदैआǓन लगावैसोई || ९६ ||
फणा पृष्ट को हृदैलेवैएडी नाͧभमͬध पुǓन देवै |
गोडा जङ्घ भूͧम पǐर लावैअङ्तर हाथ एक ठहरावै || ९७ ||
दोऊ करकी काङ्कसी राखैͧसखा जुसोय |
नासाǑद्रिष्ट लगाइयेभैरु आसन होय || ९८ ||
पहर एक आसन सͬध अआवैकु ङ्डलनी व्याकु ल होय धावै |
वधत कलेजो वदैन सोई कं वल Ǒह्रदा कौ सुधो होई || ९९ ||
Ǔतली फीहौ गोलौ जाई आंव हर सǑहड की जुनसाई |
नाडी सबैसुध होई रहैगता दोष जुभैरु दहै || १०० ||

Asana Images: https://i.pinimg.com/736x/cb/a0/e2/cba0e2d62d248b000633778b9963ed68.jpg

Technique:
1. Sit with right foot on top of left thigh.
2. Place left foot over top and to the side of left knee. 3. Twist body towards raised knee.
4. Wrap arm around raised knee and clasp hands behind back.
5. Gaze to third eye.
Visualization: Visualize the great Sage and Yogi, Matsyendranath; founder of Hatha Yoga
Sanskrit Verse:
matsyendrapītham jatharapradiptam |
pracandarugmandalakhandanāstr
am ||
abhyāsatah kundaliniprabodham |
dandasthiratvam ca dadāti pumsām ||
pārśvābhyām dhriyate yastu pārsvamatsyendramuttamam |
karena bandhayet tattu baddhamatsyendrāsanam || 60 ||
Translation: Matsyendra-pītha enhances the gastric fire and works like a weapon to destroy hosts of severe diseases. Moreover, it helps arousal of kundalini and offers stability to the spine. When held by the sides, it forms pārsva-matsyendra, which is excellent. When tied with the hand, it makes baddha-matsyendra.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
मत्स्येÛद्रपीठं जठरप्रदीप्तं प्रचण्डरुग्मण्डलखण्डनास्त्रम ्॥
अभ्यासतः कु ण्डͧलनीप्रबोधंदण्डिस्थरत्वंच
ददाǓत पुंसाम ्॥ 58॥
पाश्वभ्यांͬध्रियतेयस्तुपाश्र्वमत्स्येÛद्रमुत्तमम ् | 59 | करेण बÛधयेत ्तत्तुबद्धमत्स्येÛद्रासनम ्

Sanskrit Verse: मत्स्येÛद्रपीठं जठरप्रदीप्तं प्रचण्डरुग्मण्डलखण्डनास्त्रम ्॥
अभ्यासतः कु ण्डͧलनीप्रबोधंदण्डिस्थरत्वंच
ददाǓत पुंसाम ्॥ 58॥
पाश्वभ्यांͬध्रियतेयस्तुपाश्र्वमत्स्येÛद्रमुत्तमम ् | 59 | करेण बÛधयेत ्तत्तुबद्धमत्स्येÛद्रासनम ्

Technique:
1. Sit and bring soles of the feet together.
2. Interlace fingers around toes.
3. Keep elbows straight.
4. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize Swamiji, The SPH
Sanskrit Verse:
pādmaṁ
brāhmaṁstathāsaiddhaṁ
svāstikaṁ vājramāsanam | baddhakonaṁ bhadrapsthaṁ
mūlabandhaṁ tathaiva ca ||
Translation: This bandha can be practiced in Padmāsana, Brahmāsana, Siddhāsana, Svastikasana, Vairasana, Baddha konasana, Bhadrasana, and Mūlabandhāsana.

वाजमासनम ्।
बद्धकोणंभद्रपीठं मूलबन्धंतथैव च ॥

Technique:
1. Sit and bring heels to the perineum.
2. Place right hand on top of heels and left hand on top of right.
3. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as Lord Virabhadra
Sanskrit Verse: vṛṣaṇanī nīce sīvanīnā ḍābā bhāgamāṃ ḍābā paganī eḍī pagane ūlaṭāvīne rākhavī, ane sīvanīnā jamaṇa bhāgamāṃ jamaṇā paganī eḍī pagane ūlaṭāvīne rākhavī, ne baṃne 8 thanāṃ āṃgaḻāṃ tathā aṃgūṭhāvaḍe baṃne paganāṃ taḻāṃ tathā āṃgaḻāṃ majabūta aḍāḍī rākhavā tathā jālaṃdharabaṃdha karī nāsāgrapara dṛṣṭi rākhavī te gokṣāsana vā bhadrāsana karevāya che। viśeṣa spaṣṭīkaraṇamāṭe pariśiṣṭamāṃ āpeluṃ ā āsananuṃ citra juo
Translation: Invert the left heel and keep the toes backwards, place it underneath the left side of the perineum. Do the same with the right foot. Holding both soles of the feet tightly and then doing jalandhara bandha and gazing to the nose. This is called GorakshasanaBaddhrasana. Touching both the soles of the feet near the perineum, keeping the left hand on the heel and right hand on top, that is also called Bhadrasana.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
वृषणनी नीचेसीवनीना डाबा भागमांडाबा पगनी एडी पगने
ऊलटावीनेराखवी, अनेसीवनीना जमण भागमांजमणा पगनी
एडी पगनेऊलटावीनेराखवी, नेबंने८ थनांआंगळांतथा
अंगूठावडेबंनेपगनांतळांतथा आंगळांमजबूत अडाडी राखवा
तथा जालंधरबंध करी नासाग्रपर दृिष्ट राखवी तेगोक्षासन वा
भद्रासन करेवाय छे । ͪवशेष स्पष्टीकरणमाटेपǐरͧशष्टमा आपेलुंआ आसननुंͬचत्र जुओ

Technique:
1. Hold onto the feet and turn toes inwards and down.
2. Keep heels under the perineum and sit on the soles. 3. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize the Yoni Mandala - symbol of the creative energy of the Universe
Sanskrit Verse: pādausaṃmīlya pādāgre adhare pārṣṇiligādadhaḥ ānīya pādatalayo saṃviśet yonyāsanaṃ bahvati ॥ 106 ॥
Translation: Uniting the two feet place the fore part of them downwards and keep the heels under the groin and be seated on two soles. This is called Yonyasana.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
पादौसंमील्य पादाग्रेअधरे
पािष्णर्थाͧलगादधः आनीय
पादतलयो संͪवशेत ्योन्यासनंभवǓत ॥ १०६ ॥

Asana Number: 477
Asana Name: YONYASANA

2. Keep heels under the perineum and sit on the soles. 3. Gaze to nose.
Pranamaya: Santha Kumbhaka
Bandha: Shambavi Mudra
Mudra: Mula Bandha
Visualization: Visualize the Yoni Mandala - symbol of the creative energy of the Universe

Holding both soles of the feet tightly and then doing jalandhara bandha and gazing to the nose. This is called GorakshasanaBaddhrasana. Touching both the soles of the feet near the perineum, keeping the left hand on the heel and right hand on top, that is also called Bhadrasana.
Sanskrit Verse: वृषणनी नीचेसीवनीना डाबा भागमांडाबा पगनी एडी पगने
ऊलटावीनेराखवी, अनेसीवनीना जमण भागमांजमणा पगनी
एडी पगनेऊलटावीनेराखवी, नेबंने८ थनांआंगळांतथा
अंगूठावडेबंनेपगनांतळांतथा आंगळांमजबूत अडाडी राखवा
तथा जालंधरबंध करी नासाग्रपर दृिष्ट राखवी तेगोक्षासन वा
भद्रासन करेवाय छे । ͪवशेष स्पष्टीकरणमाटेपǐरͧशष्टमा आपेलुंआ आसननुंͬचत्र जुओ

Sanskrit Verse:
dhyāyeddhi citpadaṃ bhrāntamāsanasthaḥ sukhāya ca ।
yadi sarvāṅgamuttolyagagane khecarāsanam॥23.64॥
mahābhekāsanaṃ proktaṃ sarvasiddhipradāyakam।
mahāvidyāṃ mahāmantraṃ prāpnoti japatīha yaḥ॥23.65॥
Translation: For Bhekāsana place both the feet facing each other on the chest effortlessly; Then keep both arms on the shoulders around the feet in front. (While this āsana is being done) concentrate on the supreme consciousness looking upwards to attain bliss for the disillusioned one sitting in this āsana. If all the body parts are raised upwards uniformly, it becomes khecarāsana.
Sanskrit Verse.1:

॥
महाभेकासनंप्रोक्तंसवर्थाͧसद्ͬधप्रदायकम ्।
महाͪवद्यांमहामन्त्रंप्राÜनोǓत जपतीह यः॥ २३.६५॥

Technique:
1. Bring the soles of the feet together, toes touching to the navel.
2. Place hands on respective knees.
3. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize Swamiji, The SPH
Sanskrit Verse:
paga ulāṭā moḍī baisai
pagā kā māhilā gulapha kūlā pāṣatā lagāvai pachai pagathalyā kā piṣṭi
hāthā syau moḍi jāghā bārilī kānī āṇī pagathalī pīṣṭi lagāvai meḍha upari paga kī āgulī agra milāvai
hātha goḍā rāṣi dṛṣṭi trikuṭi
āsaṇa kauguëa pavana sarala bahai
prāna apāna kī granthi ṣuṭai saṅdhi bāī jāī
Translation: Bring the soles of feet together and heels together and touch the toes at the navel. Place the hands on knees. Fix the eyes at the tip of nose.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
पग उलाटा मोडी बैसै
पगा का माǑहला गुलफ कू ला पाषता लगावै
पछैपगथल्या का ͪपिष्ट
हाथा स्यौ मोͫड जाघा बाǐरली कानी आणी
पगथली पीिष्ट लगावै
मेढ उपǐर पग की आगुली अग्र ͧमलावै
हाथ गोडा राͪष दृिष्ट ǒत्रकु Ǒट
आसण कौगुëअ पवन सरल बहै
प्रान अपान की ग्रिन्थ षुटैसङ्ͬध बाई जाई

3. Gaze forward.

Gaze: Forward
Japa: Om Nithyananda

Technique:
1. Sit and press the two feet into the respective armpits. 2. Form a fingerlock and place the hands on the head.
3. Gaze to the nose.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as one of the seven Sapta Rishi’s
Sanskrit Verse:
dou paga ké pagathalé tina ké lāìka ju soya |
dou kāñani maià dharai nāsādriñöa samoya ॥ 62 ॥
bahurau hasta kāìkasé karai, so le āni siñā para dharai |
dina prati téna bera sadhi āvai saptariñi so nāma kahāvai ॥ 63॥
Translation: Place two soles in the respective armpits, form fingerlock and put it on head, gaze at the nose. This should be practiced three times a day for perfection.

Technique:
1. Rise up onto the knees and bend the legs inwards, heels touching one another at the groin (feet pointed outwards).
2. Keep the hands to the ankles,holding the feet in place.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as a pearl, born from the womb of an oyster
Sanskrit Verse: pārṣṇi nābhau saṃsthāpya jaṃghābahiḥpradeśena saṃmīlayet śrukyāsanaṃ bhavati ॥ 110 ॥
Translation: Keeping the heel on the navel place the upper parts of the legs united outwardly. This is called Suktyasana (the womb)

Technique:
1. Keep legs crossed, as in Padmasana.
2. Place hands down on mat in front of body.
3. Lean forward, pressing hips down.
4. Lift the head up, stick the tongue out, gaze to third eye.
Visualization: Sit and be in the space of Oneness with The SPH
Sanskrit Verse: jamaṇuṃ pagane phaṇe ḍābā paganī āṃganīce rākhīne ane ḍābā pagane phaṇe jamaṇu paganī naṃga nīce rākhīne besavuṃ, arthāta paloṃṭhī vāḻīne besavuṃ te riphyurāsana (śiṣṭāsana) kahevāya che ।
Translation: Sit with the sole of the right foot under the thigh of left leg and keep the sole of the left foot under the right thigh. In otherwords, sit cross-legged and that's called Sthitarasana (or Shishtasana)
Sanskrit Verse.1:
जमणुंपगनेफणेडाबा पगनी आंगनीचे
राखीनेअनेडाबा पगनेफणेजमणुपगनी नंग
नीचेराखीनेबेसवुं, अथार्थात पलोंठी वाळीने
बेसवुंतेǐरफ्युरासन (ͧशष्टासन) कहेवाय छे ।

Technique:
1. Sit and cross legs over opposite thighs.
2. Place palms on respective knees. 2. Raise up the apana vayu prana and retain the air.
3. Hold breath to your capacity.4. Gaze to third eye.
Visualization: Visualize yourself born from a lotus flower
Sanskrit Verse:
apānamutthāpya śanaiḥ svaśaktitaḥ prāṇaṃ samākṛṣya ca kumbhakaṃ caret ||
dhṛtvā yathāśktyanurecayaecchanaiḥ vāyuṃ gadaghnaṃ smṛtamabujāsanam || 24 ||
Translation: Gently one raises up the apāna as per the capacity and sucks the prāna and retains the air in. After retaining it up to the capacity one exhales in a sustained manner. This is ambujāsana, which alleviates diseases.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
अपानमुत्थाप्य शनैः स्वशिÈततः प्राणं
समाकृ ष्य च कु म्भकं चरेत ् ||
धृत्वा यथाश्Èत्यनुरेचयएच्छनैः वायुंगदघ्नं
स्मृतमबुजासनम ् || २४ ||
Unnamed: 19:
Asana Number: 488
Asana Name: AMBUJASANA
Technique: 1. Sit and cross legs over opposite thighs.
2. Place palms on respective knees. 2. Raise up the apana vayu prana and retain the air.
3. Hold breath to your capacity.4. Gaze to third eye.
Pranamaya: Kākacañcu Kumbhaka
Bandha: Shambavi Mudra
Mudra: Uddiyana Bandha
Visualization: Visualize yourself born from a lotus flower
Gaze: Third eye
Japa: Om Nithyananda
ParamaShivoham
Pramana Source: Hathatatvakaumudi7.24

Sanskrit Verse:
sthitvaitadāsane mantrī adhaḥśīrṣa karoti cet।
uttamāṅgāsanaṃ jñeyaṃ yogināmatidurlabham॥23.46॥
etadāsanamātreṇa śarīraṃ śītalaṃ bhavet।

Technique:
1. Sit with legs crossed, as in Padmasana.
2. Bring hands together and interlace on top of the head, forming an arch with arms.
3. Turn head to right and gaze to the armpit.
Visualization: Visualize Lord Shiva blessing you, and experiencing great peace
Sanskrit Verse:
Upaviśyāsane samyag bāhū kịtvårdhakuñcitau |
Kakṣavyomni manaḥ kurvan samam åyāti tallayāt || 79
Translation: Sitting comfortably on his seat and placing the two arms in the form of an arch overhead, the aspirant should fix his gaze in the arm-pits. As the mind gets absorbed in that posture of repose, it will experience great peace.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
उपͪवश्यासनेसम्यक्बाहूकृ त्वाधर्णकु िञ्चतौ |
कक्षिव्योिम्न मनः कु वर्णन ्शममायाǓत तल्लयात ् ||

Technique:
1. Sit with legs crossed, as in Padmasana.
2. Place right hand on forehead and left hand behind the neck.
3. Gaze to third eye.
Visualization: Visualize a river of Shakti, Conscious energy, flowing into you through the Sahasrara chakra
Sanskrit Verse:
atha kulyāsanaṃ vakṣye yatkṛtvā kauliko bhavet ||
ekahastaṃ mastakastho'dhaḥ śīrṣe'bhinnage karam |
Translation: Now I reveal about the kulyāsana, doing which one becomes qualified to live the path of a Kaulika. Rest one hand on the forehead and other on the lower part of the forehead.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
अथ कु ल्य ्āसनṃ वक्ṣयेयत्क्ṛत्व ्ā कौͧलको भवेत ्॥
एकहस्तṃ मस्तकस्थो'धḥ śīर्ṣए'ͧभÛनगेकरम ्।

Technique:
1. Sit with legs crossed, as in Padmasana.
2. Wrap the right hand around the back and hold left elbow.
3. Place left hand on the stomach.
4. Lean forward and touch the nose to the ground.
Visualization: Visualize all of the celestial Gods & Goddesses blessing you
Sanskrit Verse: atha divyāsanaṃ vakṣye pṛṣṭhaṃ hastena bandhayet || 24-23 || ekahastamadhyadeśaṃ bhūmihastañca nāsayā |
Translation: Now, I will speak about the divyāsanaṃ. Bind the back by taking one hand around it. Then place one hand on the stomach and the nose with the other.
Sanskrit Verse.1: अथ Ǒदव्यासनंवक्ष्येपृष्ठं हस्तेन बÛधयेत ् || २४-२३ || एकहस्तमÚयदेशंभूͧमहस्तञ्च नासया |

Asana Number: 496
Asana Name: DIVYASANA
Technique: 1. Sit with legs crossed, as in Padmasana.
2. Wrap the right hand around the back and hold left elbow.
3. Place left hand on the stomach.
4. Lean forward and touch the nose to the ground.
Pranamaya: Kākacañcu Kumbhaka
Bandha: Shambavi Mudra
Mudra: Mula Bandha
Visualization: Visualize all of the celestial Gods & Goddesses blessing you

Technique:
1. Sit with legs crossed, as in Padmasana.
2. Place both hands on top of the navel and raise the head upwards.
3. Inhale deeply and seal the nostrils (hold kumbhaka).
Visualization: Visualize your body becoming completely purified
Sanskrit Verse:
athānyadāsanaṃ vakṣye sādhakānāṃ hitāya vai ॥23.107॥
pavanāsarūpo khecaro Yogirāḍ bhavet।
sthitvā baddhāsane dhīro nābheradhaḥkaradvayam ॥23.108
॥
ūddharvamu ḍaḥ pibed vāyuṃ niruddhyet yamāvile।
Translation:
Now I shall talk about another asana for the benefit of the Yogi;
Doing the pavanāsana the practitioner can levitate (khechara) and becomes a king among Yogis. Remaining in badhāsana the resolute practitioner should place both hands on the upper part of the navel; Raise the head upwards and inhale the air and block the double-holed senses.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
अथाÛयदासनंवक्ष्येसाधकानांǑहताय वै॥
२३.१०७॥
पवनासरूपो खेचरो योͬगराड् भवेत ्।
िस्थत्वा बद्धासनेधीरो नाभेरधःकरद्वयम ्॥
२३.१०८
ऊद्धवर्णमुडः ͪपबेद् वायुंǓनरुद्Úयेत ्यमाͪवले।

Technique:
1. Sit with legs crossed, as in Padmasana.
2. Bring hands between legs.
3. Bend elbows and hold back of neck.
4. Tuck chin to chest.
5. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as a bat
Sanskrit Verse:
atha bhūribhukttasya pācanaṃ sadyojarāmaśūlādau valgulyāsanam
sthitvā samaṃ sarisije tṛṇa (kṛṭa ) vaṃkṣaṇorvo
raṃdhryoradhaḥ svakarakūparikau vidhāya ।
baddhvordhapāṇitala yugmata uttamāṃga ।
pārśvagalasya kalaye upari prakāmam ॥20
॥
uttāna eva cibukaṃ hrdi lāpya tiṣṭhet
kurvansamīraṇa nirodhanamekacittaḥ ।
kāye payodara udeti ca bhūridāho
dhovāyu nisṛtirudeti tadākrameṇa ॥21॥
Translation: Adopt padmasana. Insert the forearms up to elbows through thighs and calves. Take hands behind the neck and catch hold of the neck. Press the chin at the chest. Maintain a steady position. Practice pranayama with a concentrated mind in this posture.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
अथ भूǐरभुÈत्तस्य पाचनंसद्योजरामशूलादौ
वल्गुल्यासनम ्
िस्थत्वा समंसǐरͧसजेतृण (कृ ट ) वंक्षिणोवर्षो
रंध्र्योरधः स्वकरकू पǐरकौ ͪवधाय ।
बद्Úवोधर्णपाͨणतल युग्मत उत्तमांग ।
पाश्वर्णगलस्य कलयेउपǐर प्रकामम ्॥२०॥
उत्तान एव ͬचबुकं ह्र्Ǒद लाप्य Ǔतष्ठेत ्
कु वर्णÛसमीरण Ǔनरोधनमेकͬचत्तः ।
कायेपयोदर उदेǓत च भूǐरदाहो
धोवायुǓनसृǓतरुदेǓत तदाक्रमेण ॥२१॥

Technique:
1. Sit with legs crossed, as in Padmasana.
2. Bring hands between legs.
3. Bend elbows and hold back of neck.4. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize Lord Rama in your inner space
Sanskrit Verse: || atha parasarāma āsana || prathama karai padamāsana āchai sūdho sove bhūpari pāchai | goòā aru jaìghā ye dou bhū so lagatā rāñai soé || dou hātha masataga disa dhārai ābā bhū so lagata pasārai | bahuriju vāma hasata hai jāsoà dachi hathelé piñöi ju t || néké vidhi so pakarai soé nāsā agra diñoi rahai goé | sakala saréra karana ārāma āsana parasarāma senāma ||
Translation: Sit on the anus with folded legs and knees pointing upward. Insert both the hands up to the elbow in between thigh muscles and calf muscles. Bring the legs near the body, resulting in soles lifted upward. Gaze should be at the tip of the nose.

॥

Technique:
1. Sit with legs crossed, as in Padmasana.
2. Bring hands between legs.
3. Bend elbows and place hands over the ears and hold.
4. Roll onto back, rock forwards & backwards making one full circle, coming back to original position.
Visualization: Visualize yourself generating unlimited potential energy
Sanskrit Verse:
māyūraṁ piñchamāyūraṁ
padmapithasamanvitam | kaukkutaṁ garbhapindaṁ ca kaurmaṁ yoganrsimhakam ||
Translation: (Examples of best asanas are) Mayūrāsana and Pincha Mayūrāsana along with Padmāsana, Kukkutasana, Garbhapindāsana, Kūrmāsana, and Yoga Nrsimhāsana.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
मायूरं ͪपञ्छमायूरं पद्मपीठसमिÛवतम ्।
कौकु टं गभर्णͪपण्डंच कौमर्णयोगनृͧस ंहकम ्॥
Unnamed: 19:
Asana Number: 500
Asana Name: GARBHAPINDASANA
Technique: 1. Sit with legs crossed, as in Padmasana.
2. Bring hands between legs.
3. Bend elbows and place hands over the ears and hold.
4. Roll onto back, rock forwards & backwards making one full circle, coming back to original position.
Pranamaya: Ujjayi Kumbhaka
Bandha: Shambavi Mudra
Mudra: Mula Bandha
Visualization: Visualize yourself generating unlimited potential energy
Gaze: To nose
Japa: Om Nithyananda
ParamaShivoham
Pramana Source: Nathamuni’sYogaRahasya2.15

3. Lean forward, pressing hips down.
4. Lift the head up, stick the tongue out, gaze to third eye.
Visualization: Embody the space and state of a lion

Technique:
1. Sit with legs crossed, as in Padmasana.
2. Place hands on mat in front and lift legs up.
3. Gaze forward.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as a rooster
Sanskrit Verse:
ūrdhvakukkuta vāsiştha marici hala matsyakam | parivsttiṁ
codarasya vividhar dhanurāsanam ||
Translation: Urdhva kukkuţāsana, Vasişthasana, Maricyāsana, Halāsana, Matsyāsana, and different types of Jathara parivrtti and Dhanurāsana. All āsanas can be modified to suit the needs of the individual.

ऊÚवर्णकु कु टवाͧसष्ठमरीͬचहलमत्स्यकम ्।
पǐरवृͪत्त ंचोदरस्य ͪवͪवधंधनुरासनम ्॥

Technique:
1. Place feet on opposite thighs, as in Padmasana.
2. Bring hands around back and hold opposite toes.
3. Press chin to chest.
4. Gaze to nose
Visualization: Visualize yourself as a lotus flower
Sanskrit Verse:
atha padmāsanama
vāmorūpari dakṣiṇaṃ ca caraṇaṃ saṃsthāpya vāmaṃ tathā
dakṣorūpari paścimena vidhinā dhṛtvā karābhyāṃ dṛḍham ।
aṅguṣṭau hṛdaye nidhāya cibukaṃ nāsāgramālokayet
etadvyādhivināśakāri yamināṃ padmāsanaṃ procyate ॥46॥
Translation: Place the right foot on the left thigh and the left foot on the right thigh, and grasp the toes with the hands crossed over the back. Press the chin against the chest and gaze on the tip of the nose. This is called the Padmâsana, the destroyer of the diseases of the Yamîs.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
अथ पद्मासनम
वामोरूपǐर दͯक्षिणंच चरणंसंस्थाप्य वामं
तथा
दक्षिोरूपǐर पिश्चमेन ͪवͬधना धृत्वा कराभ्यां
दृढम ्।
अङ्गुष्टौ हृदयेǓनधाय ͬचबुकं
नासाग्रमालोकयेत ्
एतद्व्याͬधͪवनाशकाǐर यͧमनांपद्मासन प्रोच्यते॥४६॥

3. Press chin to chest.
4. Gaze to nose
Pranamaya: Ujjayi Kumbhaka
Bandha: prana mudra
Mudra: Jalandhara Bandha
Visualization: Visualize yourself as a lotus flower
Gaze: To nose
Japa: Om Nithyananda
ParamaShivoham
Pramana Source: HathapradapikaofSwatmarama45

Technique:
1. Sit with legs crossed, as in Padmasana.
2. Bring hands around back and hold opposite toes.
3. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as a lotus flower
Sanskrit Verse:
padmāsanaṃ susaṃsthāpya tadaṅguṣṭhadvayaṃ punaḥ |
vyutkrameṇaiva hastābhyāṃ baddhapadmāsanaṃ bhavet ॥ 40 ॥
Translation: Having well established the Padmasana posture, (should one hold) the two big toes with (his) two hands stretched crosswise, it becomes theBaddha-padmasana (the bound-lotus-position)
Sanskrit Verse.1:
पद्मासनंसुसंस्थाप्य तदङ्गुष्ठद्वयंपुनः
।
व्युत्क्रमेण ्ऐव हस्ताभ्यांबद्धपद्मासनं
भवेत ्॥ ४० ॥

Technique:
1. Place feet on opposite thighs, as in Padmasana.
2. Bring hands to either side of the neck and gently press the Vijnana Nadis.
3. Press chin to chest.
4. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize Yourself as Paramashiva and Renounce the Society of Men
Sanskrit Verse:
padmāsanasthitā yogī janasaṃgavivarjitaḥ।
vijñānanāḍīdvitayamaṅagulībhyā
ṃ nirodhayet ॥ 36॥
sakṛdyaḥ kurute yogī pāpaughaṃ nāśayedbhavam ।
tasya syānmadhyame vāyoḥ praveśo nātra saṃśayaḥ ॥ 39॥
Translation: Sitting in the padmāsana posture, renouncing the society of men, let the Yogi press the two vijñāna nādis (the vessels of consciousness, coronary arteries) with his two lingers… The Yogi, who does it even once, verily destroys all sins; and undoubtedly in him the vāyus enter the middle channel.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
पद्मासनिस्थता योगी जनसंगͪवविजर्णतः।
ͪवज्ञाननाडीद्ͪवतयमङगुलीभ्यांǓनरोधयेत ्॥
३६॥
सकृ द्यः कु रुतेयोगी पापौघंनाशयेद्भवम ्।
तस्य स्याÛमÚयमेवायोः प्रवेशो नात्र संशयः ॥ ३९॥

Verse Translation: Sitting in the padmāsana posture, renouncing the society of men, let the Yogi press the two vijñāna nādis (the vessels of consciousness, coronary arteries) with his two lingers… The Yogi, who does it even once, verily destroys all sins; and undoubtedly in him the vāyus enter the middle channel.
Sanskrit Verse: पद्मासनिस्थता योगी जनसंगͪवविजर्णतः।
ͪवज्ञाननाडीद्ͪवतयमङगुलीभ्यांǓनरोधयेत ्॥
३६॥
सकृ द्यः कु रुतेयोगी पापौघंनाशयेद्भवम ्।
तस्य स्याÛमÚयमेवायोः प्रवेशो नात्र संशयः ॥ ३९॥
Asana Images: https://i.pinimg.com/736x/ee/96/ce/ee96ced8b44a9c65d5f67152ebb577cf.jpg

Technique:
1. Sit with legs crossed, as in Padmasana.
2. Lay down on back and lift legs upwards.
3. Bring hands to lower back, elbows on mat.
4. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as an inverted lotus flower
Sanskrit Verse: prathama ardhapadmāsananī peṭhe besī pachī sūī māthuṃ bheyapara rākhī keḍane baṃne hāthanā ādhārathī uṃcī karī te paloṃṭhī adhara ūpāḍī rākhavī te ūrdhvapaghāsana kahevāya che।
Translation: Start by doing ardha-padmasana, then lay down keeping the head on the ground, using both the hands to support the waist and lift up the legs. This is called Urdhva Padmasana.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
प्रथम अधर्णपद्मासननी पेठेबेसी पछी सूई माथुं
भेयपर राखी के डनेबंनेहाथना आधारथी उं ची
करी तेपलोंठी अधर ऊपाडी राखवी त ऊÚवर्णपघासन कहेवाय छे ।

Asana Images:

Technique:
1. Sit and cross the legs, as in Padmasana.
2. Bring palms together and raise them straight above the head.
3. Engage all three bandhas.4. Gaze to nose.
Visualization: Visualize yourself as a Mountain; standing stable for thousands of years
Sanskrit Verse:
atha vakṣye mahādeva parvatāsanamaṅgalam।
yat kṛtvā sthirarūpī syāt ṣaṭcakrādivilopanam॥23.52॥
Translation:
O Mahādeva! now I shall talk about auspicious parvatāsana;
Practising which (mental) stability is gained, and the penetration of the six cakras is called parvatāsana. To cleanse the urinary bladder, liver, spleen and diaphragm, Parvatasana must be done in seated and lying down positions. Also known as tadasana variation and can be practiced sitting or lying down
Sanskrit Verse.1:
अथ वक्ष्येमहादेव पवर्णतासन मङ्गलं I
यत ्कृ त्वा िस्थररूपी स्यात ्
षट्चक्राǑदͪवलोपनम ्॥२३.५२॥

Bandha: Shambavi Mudra
Mudra: Mahamudra Bandha
Visualization: Visualize yourself as a Mountain; standing stable for thousands of years
Gaze: To nose

Asana Images: https://i.pinimg.com/736x/e8/7e/0d/e87e0d7dc0a149a14c847ec1825ae2cf.jpg

Technique:
1. Lay down on back with legs extended.
2. Keep palms facing upwards.
3. Continuously unclutch from body and mind.
Visualization: Visualize the Body is Dead, and The SPH is Liberating You
Sanskrit Verse:
atha cittaviśrāntau savāsanam uttanamūrvyā śayanam vidhāya prasārya pādau karasammputam hradi |
nāsāgra ādhāya dṛśam smaran śivam prsthotthitiryatra savasanam hi tat ||
savāsanam hratkupitavātagranthivibhedakam | sarvāsanaśrāntijit hratśramaghnam yogisaukhyadam ||
Translation: One lies on the ground in supine position. Legs are a part, placing the folded palms on the chest, gaze fixed at the tip of the nose while meditating on Śiva. This is savasana. Practice of Śavasana cures the knots (obstructions) caused due to vitiated vata in the chest, removes the fatigue of the body and mind arising due to the practice of all the asanas and exhaustion. This brings wellbeing to the yogi.
Sanskrit Verse.1:
अथ ͬचत्तͪवश्राÛतौ शवासनम ्
उत्तनमूÚयार्णशयनंͪवधाय
प्रसायर्णपादौ करसंम्पुटं हृǑद ।
नासाग्र आधाय दृशंस्मरन ्ͧशवं
पृष्ठोित्थǓतयंत्र शवासनंǑह तत ्॥११॥
शवासनंह्रत्कु ͪपतवातग्रिÛथͪवभेदकम ्।
सवार्णसनश्रािÛतिजत ्हत्श्रममंयोͬगसौख्यदम ्॥१२॥
